instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into chilled cocktail or margarita glass.

name: Caucasian
instructions: Pour vodka and coffee liqueur (kahlua) over ice cubes. Add desired amount of Half-and-Half.

name: Cavalier
instructions: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Cavanaugh's Special
instructions: Pour coffee liqueur into a brandy snifter and set aside. Combine white reme de cacao, amaretto and vanilla ice cream in a blender with ice cubes. Blend until smooth. Pour over coffee liqueur. Top with whipped cream and chocolate sprinkles, and serve.

name: Cave In
instructions: Pour the amaretto, Bacardi 151 and Southern Comfort into an old-fashioned glass 3/4 filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Add cranberry juice to taste, and stir again briefly. Add a splash of orange juice, and serve.

name: Celebration
instructions: In a cocktail shaker add ingredients and fill with ice. Shake with gusto for half a minute, and pour/strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon peel, or lime peel if you use fresh lime juice.

name: Celebration #2
instructions: Shake vigorously over ice, pour into cocktail glass and garnish with either lemon or orange peel.

name: Celeste Sunrise
instructions: Pour the Frangelico hazelnut liqueur, strawberry liqueur, advocaat and cream into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with lemonade until frothy. Garnish with a strawberry, and serve.

name: Celtic
instructions: Stir ingredients together in an old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Celtic Mix Cocktail
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Celtic Twilight
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass half-filled with cracked ice. Stir well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass 1/4 filled with cracked ice, and serve.

name: Cemetary Cider
instructions: Combine the rums and whiskey over ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake well. Add the apple cider and stir lightly. Pour into a pint glass, and serve.

name: Centauri Sundown
instructions: Pour the vodka and grenadine into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with sour mix, to taste, and serve.

name: Centenario
instructions: Stir ingredients and strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with broken ice. Garnish with a sprig of mint and fruit.

name: Centipede
instructions: Combine vodka and rum in cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into old-fashioned glass with ice. Top off with grapefruit soda and stir gently.

name: Cerebral Hemorrhage
instructions: Fill an old-fashioned glass with ice. Add Kahlua, then carefully layer on Bailey's, then the peach schnapps. Add a few drops of grenadine for effect.

name: Cesar Ritz
instructions: Stir and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a red cherry, soaked in eau de vie.

name: Cessna
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Chai Toddy
instructions: Stir all ingredients in a mug and serve steaming hot. Garnish with a peppermint stick.

name: Chain Lightning
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Chambord and Cognac
instructions: Heat both ingredients gently. Pour into a brandy snifter, and serve.

name: Chambord Daiquiri
instructions: Blend with one cup of crushed ice in a shaker or blender for 30 seconds. Strain into a champagne saucer, and serve.

name: Chambord Frost
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into an old-fashioned or rocks glass, and serve.

name: Chambord Kamikaze
instructions: Muddle lime in a shaker. Add ice and all other ingredients. Shake vigorously. Strain into a glass.

name: Chambord Kiss
instructions: Layer Irish cream, then raspberry liqueur into a pousse cafe glass. Use Chambord raspberry liqueur.

name: Chambord Margarita
instructions: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and pour over ice in a salt-rimmed margarita glass. Serve.

name: Chambord Martini
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a twist of lemon.

name: Chambord Royale
instructions: Pour the Chambord raspberry liqueur, vodka, pineapple and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chambord Royale
instructions: Should be shaked over ice. Garnished with a lemon. More pineapple than cranberry juice.

name: Chambord Royale
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into a martini glass, and serve.

name: Chambord Sling
instructions: Blend ingredients in a bar blender. Serve in a sour glass.

name: Chambord Sour
instructions: Blend with ice.

name: Champagne Bleu
instructions: Serve in a chilled Champagne flute.

name: Champagne Gem
instructions: Put creme de menthe in the flute first, then add champagne and stir slightly. Make sure your champagne is cold.

name: Champagne Hula
instructions: Pour the Whaler's Pineapple Paradise rum into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Add the Grand Marnier orange liqueur, pineapple juice and grenadine. Shake well and strain into a champagne glass. Top with Champagne. Garnish with a strawberry slice on the rim, and serve.

name: Champagne Lemon
instructions: Pour into a champagne saucer, and serve.

name: Champagne Martini
instructions: Mix and serve.

name: Champagne Passion
instructions: Pour passion fruit puree into a champagne saucer and stir in the simple syrup (to taste). Slowly add the champagne whilst stirring gently. Float the alize on top, and serve.

name: Champagne Tropicale
instructions: Pour the mango puree into a mixing glass, then slowly add the champagne whilst stirring gently. Float the maraschino on top, and serve.

name: Champs Elysees Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chamtini
instructions: Stir and strain into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice. Add the twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Chandos Club
instructions: Pour into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice.

name: Chanel #5
instructions: Slice the lemon and lime into wedges (3 lemon & 4 lime) and muddle together with the sugar syrup. Add alcoholic ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into chilled glass.

ingredients.name: Marie Brizard® white creme de cacao liqueur

name: Chantelle
instructions: Mix Galliano, Grenadine and Vanilla Schnapps with ice and then pour into champagne flute. Add chilled Champagne. For effect pour Champagne down the side of the flute.

name: Chanticleer
instructions: Pour the gin, lemon juice and raspberry syrup and egg white into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, strain into an old-fashioned glass 1/2 filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Chaos Cocktail
instructions: Shake, strain, add the cherry and serve.

name: Chapala
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.

name: Chapel Hill
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of orange peel, and serve.

name: Chapman
instructions: Take the pisang ambon in the glas, and then the milk. Then shake it. Enjoy!

name: Charap Margarita
instructions: Freeze the Minute Maid punch cooler (individual pack) in the freezer until icy. Take it out and blend it with some ice then add the absolut vodka and margarita mix. Pour into a margarita glass and serve.

name: Charger
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Charging Rhino
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with twist of lemon.

name: Charles Bronson
instructions: Combine all whiskeys together in a 24 oz. mug glass with about 4-5 ice cubes. Fill the glass with any brand of birch beer, and serve.

name: Charles Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Charles's Daiquiri
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Charles's Nightcap
instructions: Stir and strain into a brandy snifter.

name: Charlie Chaplin
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

name: Charlie Coke
instructions: Add the Absolut Vodka to a cocktail glass filled with ice, top off with Coca-Cola.

name: Charlie Shaker
instructions: Add aquavit and Charleston Follies and stir it with ice. Add lime and tonic water. Fresh up with slice of lemon and red cocktail berry.

name: Charlie's Revenge
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass.

name: Charmer
instructions: Shake ingredients with crushed ice. Strain into cocktail glass.

name: Charon
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a glass.

name: Charro
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into an old-fashioned glass.

name: Charro Negro
instructions: Rub rim of glass with lemon juice and dip rim in salt. Put 4 ice cubes into the glass, add Tequila and juice of half a lemon. Add some more salt if you like and fill the glass with Coca-Cola. Stir gently.

name: Chartini
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Chartreuse Chocolate Kiss
instructions: Combine ingredients in an Irish coffe mug. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle of chocolate shavings.

name: Chartreuse Cocktail
instructions: Stir and strain into a cordial glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Charybdis
instructions: Shake all ingredients except the orange twist, and strain into a cocktail glass. Squeeze orange rind over drink to release oils and drop into the drink.

name: Chastity Belt
instructions: Layer in order in an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Chatham Cocktail
instructions: Pour the gin, ginger brandy, lemon juice and sugar into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a piece of candied ginger, and serve.

name: Cheap Sunglasses
instructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Add vodka, then fill with equal parts cranberry juice and 7-up.

name: Checkerboard
instructions: Blend in a bar blender at low speed. Serve in a champagne flute topped with chocolate shavings.

name: Cheese Sandwich
instructions: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice.

name: Cheesecake Martini
instructions: Shake all ingredients together in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chelsea Cocktail
instructions: Pour the vermouth, bourbon, blackberry brandy, Cointreau and lemon juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Chelsea Hotel
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Chelsea Sidecar
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cherasberry Rum and Coke
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a highball glass filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Cherie
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

name: Cherried Cream Rum
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Cherry Amaretto
instructions: Shake ingredients together and strain into glass. Adjust ingredient ratio for sweetness preferences.

name: Cherry Back
description: This goes down quite smooth, with quick results.  Originated at a Oregon ski resort. Ski instructors had to be "victims" for the ski patrol to practice a chair evacuation.  After that, you need a strong drink!Fill cocktail class with ice, add 151, top with Cherry Coke. Stir.
instructions: Fill cocktail class with ice, add 151, top with Cherry Coke. Stir.

name: Cherry Blossom
instructions: Garnish with a cherry on the rim of the glass.

name: Cherry Blossom #2
instructions: Moisten rim of a cocktail glass with cherry brandy and rub rim in powdered sugar. Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into the sugar-rimmed glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

name: Cherry Bomb
instructions: Serve as a shot or on the rocks in an old-fashioned glass.

name: Cherry Bomb #9
instructions: Stir the whisky and the wine together in a sour glass. Top with cola, and serve.

name: Cherry Breeze
instructions: Put cherry in bottom of glass, add ice. pour grenadine over ice wait until it settles at the bottom, then add banana liqueur, peach schnapps, and vodka. Pour orange juice on top slowly, do the same with the pineapple juice. You should have the cup a little over 3/4s full now squirt the 7-up over top. DO NOT MIX!!! Drink with a straw.

name: Cherry Cobbler
instructions: Pour into a double-cocktail glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a slice of lemon, a cherry and a mint sprig. Serve with a short straw.

name: Cherry Coke
instructions: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Cherry Cola
instructions: Combine and stir. Tastes like Cherry Coke.

name: Cherry Comfort
instructions: Pour about 4 oz of your favorite cherry cola into a cup. Add about 1 shot (1 oz) of southern comfort 100 proof. Add ice if desired.

name: Cherry Cream Rum
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Cherry Crush
instructions: Muddle four of the cherries with the lemon juice and maraschino in a mixing glass. Add gin, shake well with ice, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with remaining cherry, and serve.

name: Cherry Flip
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

name: Cherry Gimlet
instructions: Garnish a cocktail glass with 1 to 2 marashino cherries and a few ice cubes. Shake all ingredients with ice to chill and then strain into the glass and serve.

name: Cherry Hill
instructions: Sugar the rim of a cocktail glass using a maraschino cherry to wet the rim. Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into the sugared glass. Garnish with the cherry used to sugar the rim.

name: Cherry Kiss
instructions: Shake all ingredients well and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass. Dust with grated nutmeg, and serve.

name: Cherry Kiss #2
instructions: Pour the Bailey's irish cream into a pousse cafe glass. Carefully pour the Chambord over the back of a teaspoon in order to float it on top of the Bailey's. Serve.

name: Cherry Licorice
instructions: Shake everything with ice and strain into glass. Garnish with Licorice Allsorts candy.

name: Cherry Lifesaver
instructions: Pour both ingredients over a small handful of crushed ice in a cocktail glass. Stir, and serve.

name: Cherry Lime-aid
instructions: Use a 16 oz. glass filled with ice.  Add the three olives cherry and squeeze the limes fresh, leaving them in the glass.  Add a splash of sours (or more depending on taste) and fill the rest of the glass with lemon lime soda.  Add several cherries to garnish.  Tastes like the childhood treat with plenty of kick...

name: Cherry Long Island
instructions: Shake all ingredients except Sprite in a pint glass with ice, then top with Sprite. Garnish with a lemon wedge and a cherry.

name: Cherry Lover
instructions: Combine the first 5 ingredients into a cocktail shaker. Shake well for 20 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass. Top with Club Soda.

name: Cherry Martini
instructions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker and shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry at the bottom, and serve.

name: Cherry Popper
instructions: Add the strawberry schnapps to a glass, and fill with 7-Up. Drop in a cherry, and serve.

name: Cherry Popper #3
instructions: Pour Crown Royal Canadian whisky over ice (preferably 3-4 cubes), add Cherry Coca-Cola, stir lightly, and serve.

name: Cherry Repair Kit
instructions: Combine all ingredients together with half a cup or less of crushed ice in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into a medium-sized cocktail glass, garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Cherry Ripe
instructions: Pour vodka, cherry brandy and brandy into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Cherry Rum
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cherry Sling
instructions: Pour brandy and lemon juice into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

name: Cherry Spitfire
instructions: Mix the ingredients and top with the 151 Proof Rum. If it's too strong, add 7-Up or Sprite.

name: Cherry Tree Climber
instructions: Blend briefly with half a glassful of crushed ice. Pour into a double-cocktail glass.

name: Cherry Vodka Sour
instructions: Place ice in a cocktail glass. Fill 1/2 the glass with Vodka and the rest of the glass (leaving 3 cm at the top) with sour mix. Add a tablespoon of Grenadine per 8 oz. glass. Garnish with an orange slice and cherry!

name: Cherrylicious
instructions: Add all ingredients together in a shaker half filled with ice. Shake until chilled. Strain into a large cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cherrytini
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chewbacca
instructions: Build as listed, garnish with orange, then scream like a wookie.

name: Chi-Chi
instructions: Blend vodka, pineapple juice, and cream of coconut with one cup ice in an electric blender at a high speed. Pour into a red wine glass, decorate with the slice of pineapple and the cherry, and serve.

name: Chicago Apple Cider
instructions: Stir the Canadian Mist whisky and Goldschlager cinnamon schnapps together in an old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice cubes. Add apple juice to taste, and serve.

name: Chicago Cocktail
instructions: Rub the rim of an old-fashioned glass with lemon and dip in powdered sugar. Pour the brandy, bitters and triple sec into a mixing glass half-filled with cracked ice. Stir well. Pour into the prepared glass, and serve.

name: Chicks Dig It
instructions: Pour into an ice-filled glass and shake, or serve up in a cocktail glass.

name: Chili Margarita
description:
This recipe for Chili Margarita came from a Thai restaurant/ bar called the Lava Lounge in Eugene, Oregon (pacific northwest).Cut the pineapple into big half-ring slices/chuncks. Place them in a 1-gallon or more jar, along with the whole jalapenos and fill with the tequila. Let age for at least 2 weeks. 

When properly aged, fill a cocktail shaker with ice, lemonade, lime juice, and 1 to 2 oz of the pineapple-jalapeno infused mixture (depending on taste). Shake, and pour in a chilled, salt rimmed  margarita glass. Garnish with slice of lemon, lime, and a small jalapeno ring. Enjoy this sweet and spicy refreshing margarita!
instructions:
Cut the pineapple into big half-ring slices/chuncks. Place them in a 1-gallon or more jar, along with the whole jalapenos and fill with the tequila. Let age for at least 2 weeks. 

When properly aged, fill a cocktail shaker with ice, lemonade, lime juice, and 1 to 2 oz of the pineapple-jalapeno infused mixture (depending on taste). Shake, and pour in a chilled, salt rimmed  margarita glass. Garnish with slice of lemon, lime, and a small jalapeno ring. Enjoy this sweet and spicy refreshing margarita!

name: Chili Marnier
instructions:
Muddle (crush) the chili pepper, lime wedges, and sugar in a chilled old fashioned glass. Add Grand Marnier. Add ice cubes to just over the top of the liquid, stir until sugar dissolves, and serve.

Can substitute 1 oz lime juice and plain sugar for the brown sugar.

name: Chill-Out Cafe
instructions: Combine ingredients in an Irish coffee mug.

name: Chilled Chocolate Grasshopper
instructions: Blend the ice cream, food coloring and schnapps together and add to the cocktail glass. Drizzle the chocolate over the top and then sprinkle the chocolate chips over the top and enjoy!

name: Chilled Orgasm
instructions: Place the ice cream in a blender and add the Bailey's, milk and rum. Top with ice, and blend well. Pour into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chilton
instructions: Fill a salt rimmed cocktail glass with ice. Pour in vodka and add lemon juice. Fill with soda. Insert straw and stir slightly. Garnish with a lemon wedge.

name: Chinatown
instructions: Blend until smooth. Add a glassful of crushed ice and blend again briefly. Serve with straws in a rocks or old-fashioned glass.

name: Chinese Cocktail
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chinese Cocktail #2
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chinese Mary
instructions: Make like a Bloody Mary, improvising with ingredients until you find your preferred taste and texture. Try adding extra vodka to thin out the sauce a little. When heated, this also makes a great sauce for food.

name: Chippy
instructions: Shake all ingredients well w/ ice, ensuring the honey is fully dissolved. Strain into glass and float a thin lemon slice on top, and serve.

name: Choclatini
instructions: Line your martini glass with Hershey's Chocolate Shell then place it in the freezer to harden the shell and chill the glass. Mix all liquors in a shaker with ice. Pour into chilled glass. Garnish with whipped cream and a cherry.

name: Choco Buca
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Choco-banana Tini
instructions: Swirl chocolate syrup into your chilled cocktail glass. Shake cream, white Creme de Cacao, banana liqueur and vanilla vodka with ice and strain into cocktail glass. Drop in sliced bananas for a garnish.

name: Chocodka
instructions: Pour both ingredients into an old-fashioned glass, stir, and serve.

name: Chocolate Banana
instructions: Pour creme de banane into an ice-filled glass. Add creme de cacao, fill with milk, and serve.

name: Chocolate Banana Banshee
instructions: Pour the white creme de cacao, banana liqueur and cream into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chocolate Banana Fudgsicle
instructions: Stir the McGuinness Creme de Bananes liqueur and the chocolate milk together in an old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice cubes. Garnish with banana slice and serve.

name: Chocolate Banana Sherbet
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth and freeze overnight. Before serving, break up the frozen mixture and blend until smooth with 2 tbsp. of cold water. Serve with a spoon in a frosted goblet, and serve.

name: Chocolate Bomb
instructions: Put equal amounts of kahlua and coconut rum (malibu or parrot bay) into an old-fashioned 12 oz glass. Fill the glass with chocolate milk, and serve.

name: Chocolate Boobie
instructions: Place all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with a few ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chocolate Cake Martini
instructions: Fill two cocktail glasses with ice water; set aside. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, add vanilla vodka, creme de cacao, and Frangelico hazelnut liqueur. Shake vigorously. Empty glasses of ice water, and dip edges into a flat dish filled with sweetened cocoa powder. Strain the contents of the cocktail shaker into the 2 cocktail glasses, and add a twist of lemon to each before serving.

name: Chocolate Candy
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Stir, pour into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chocolate Cappuccino
instructions: Pour Carolan's irish cream, creme de cacao, Kahlua coffee liqueur and milk into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, until frothy. Strain into a cocktail/martini glass, garnish with a chocolate ovation, and serve.

name: Chocolate Carmel Martini
instructions: Mix ingredients in mixing cup with ice. Shake, pour into chilled cocktail glass, and enjoy.

name: Chocolate Cherry Bomb
instructions: Layer this drink: grenadine, then the Cacao, then the cream. Shoot. Tastes just like a chocolate covered cherry.

name: Chocolate Chicken
instructions: Fill glass with ice, add all ingredients and fill the rest of the glass with cream!

name: Chocolate Chimp
instructions: In shaker with ice combine all liquids and shake vigourously. Pour into a large cocktail glass swirled with chocolate syrup. Should appear thick and foamy. Garnish with banana slice and chocolate sprinkles.

name: Chocolate Chip
instructions: Half fill a shaker with ice. Add liqueurs and top with milk. Shake and pour over ice.

name: Chocolate City
instructions: Fill glass with ice. Add Baileys and rum, then creme de cacao and banana liqueur, then fill with cream.

name: Chocolate Cloud
instructions: Pour the creme de cacao into a cocktail glass. Carefully layer the blue curacao on top by pouring slowly over the back of a teaspoon. Top with whipped cream. Sprinkle chocolate shavings across the cream, and serve.

name: Chocolate Corvette
instructions: Pour the rum, creme de cacao and hot chocolate into an Irish coffee cup or glass. Pour the cream carefully over the back of a teaspoon so that it floats on top, and serve.

name: Chocolate Covered Banana
instructions: Pour all ingredients over ice. Garnish with slice of banana.

name: Chocolate Covered Strawberry
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with a fresh strawberry, and serve.

name: Chocolate Covered Strawberry Daiquiri
instructions: Combine ingredients in a blender, and blend well. Pour into a chilled daiquiri/margarita glass, garnish with a chocolate covered strawberry, and serve.

name: Chocolate Dream
instructions: Mix the Bailey's, ice cream and vodka. Drizzle chocolate syrup on top and add chocolate chips.

name: Chocolate Espresso
instructions: Swirl chocolate syrup around a martini glass. Mix all ingredients together in shaker with ice, and then strain into the glass.

name: Chocolate Flip
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with nutmeg on top.

name: Chocolate Heaven Martini for 2
instructions: Pour all ingredients into an ice-filled cocktail shaker. Shake and pour into 2 chilled cocktail glasses, and serve.

name: Chocolate Hurricane
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

ingredients.name: Captain Morgan® Parrot Bay coconut rum

name: Chocolate Kiss
description: Chocolate Kiss is a delicious and now staple drink at The Villages bar, Florida where it was created by 'tender Jaime Lane.Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a martini cocktail glass, and serve.
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a martini cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chocolate Lovers Martini
instructions: Take a martini glass and squeeze in chocolate syrup. Mix all alcohol ingredients in a shaker and pour into glass. Drop a Hershey's Kiss on top.

name: Chocolate Maple Moo
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour into glass. Add chocolate shavings on the top of the drink.

name: Chocolate Martini #4
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a cocktail shaker with a few ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass and serve.

ingredients.name: Vincent Van Gogh® Dutch chocolate vodka

name: Chocolate Martini #5
instructions: Mix cocoa and powdered sugar to taste. Dip rim of a large martini glass in caramel sauce, then in cocoa/sugar mixture. Put a drop of chocolate in bottom of glass. Shake Stoli, creme de cacao and praline liqueur in a shaker to chill. Fill glass almost full with crushed or shaved ice. Strain drink into glass. Garnish with shaved chocolate, and serve.

name: Chocolate Martini Lite
description: Chocolate Martini Lite was created by Scott Petric, Shorewood Illinois. It makes great use of chocolate candy to add flavor to an already sublime chocolate martini recipe. Andes is an after-dinner dark chocolate mint, so if you can't get hold of them, try another brand, you can't go far wrong.While chilling a cocktail glass, shake vodka, creme de cacao, and milk. Pour into the chilled cocktail glass over 1/2 chunk of Andes mint chocolate candy, and serve.
instructions: While chilling a cocktail glass, shake vodka, creme de cacao, and milk. Pour into the chilled cocktail glass over 1/2 chunk of Andes mint chocolate candy, and serve.

name: Chocolate Milk with a Kick
instructions: Chill all ingredients and pour in glass.

name: Chocolate Milkshake
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Adjust amount of milk if desired. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chocolate Mint Martini
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a sprig of mint and an After Eight mint stick.

name: Chocolate Mint Rum
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Chocolate Mint Smooth
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Chocolate Mountain
instructions: Shake all ingredients except Kahlua in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and add the Kahlua to the center.

name: Chocolate Pirate
instructions: Blend ingredients in a blender until smooth. Serve in a chilled wine goblet.

name: Chocolate Punch
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Dust with grated nutmeg, and serve.

name: Chocolate Raspberry Brownie
instructions: Fill the glass with ice cubes. Pour in the liqueurs and then top with cream. Garnish with chocolate shavings on the top.

name: Chocolate Raspberry Cream
instructions: Blend ingredients in a bar blender until smooth. Serve in a champagne flute.

name: Chocolate Ravage
description: One glass of Chocolate Ravage will knock you down. The recipe was shared generously by Jon and Brandon. You can find the Pop-Ice at Walmart in the juice isle in a cardboard box for about $2. Chocolate Ravage has a chocolatey taste (due to Yoo-hoo chocolate milk) so your guests are sure to love it.Add ice to a blender until roughly one-quarter to one-third full. Add one sheet worth of pop ice to the blender. Add the vodka, Captain Morgan rums, triple sec, sugar and honey. Adjust sugar and honey to taste if desired. Add one tall yoo-hoo bottle to the blender. Blend until puree consistancy, pour into cocktail glasses and serve.
instructions: Add ice to a blender until roughly one-quarter to one-third full. Add one sheet worth of pop ice to the blender. Add the vodka, Captain Morgan rums, triple sec, sugar and honey. Adjust sugar and honey to taste if desired. Add one tall yoo-hoo bottle to the blender. Blend until puree consistancy, pour into cocktail glasses and serve.

ingredients.name: Captain Morgan® Parrot Bay coconut rum

name: Chocolate Shock
instructions: Pour aftershock into a heatproof cup with hot chocolate, and serve.

name: Chocolate Snow Bear
instructions: Combine all ingredients in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute and serve.

name: Chocolate Soldier
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Chocolate Stick
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Chocolate to Die For
instructions: Pour the chocolate vodka over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Add cream soda (IBC preferred), and serve.

name: Chocolate Twist
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Chocolate Vice
instructions: Pour the rum, bourbon, creme de cacao and hot chocolate into an Irish coffee cup or glass. Spoon the cream carefully on top, and serve.

name: Chocolatey Orange Sunset
instructions: Pour Sunny D into a cocktail glass, then pour in the shot of Kahlua. Let settle at bottom, and sit back and look at the fine mix of brown and orange.

name: Chocolatier
instructions: Combine all ingredients (except chocolate shavings) in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute, garnish with chocolate shavings, and serve.

name: Chocolatier Cake
instructions: Chill all ingredients prior. Layer in order into a cocktail glass; creme de cacao first, brandy on top, followed by cream.

name: Chocolatini
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass.

name: Chocotini
instructions: Shake vodka, Creme de Cacao and Triple Sec with ice. Pour into martini glass, then add Kahlua (it will settle on bottom). Garnish with cherry.

name: Choker
instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Choklad Prins Bertil
instructions: Pre-warm a coffee mug, then add Grand Marnier and cognac. Fill with hot chocolate and stir well. Top with whipped cream.

name: Chop Nut
instructions: Shake well and strain into a double-cocktail glass filled with broken ice.

name: Chowning's Tavern Wine Cooler
instructions: This makes a colorful as well as refreshing drink if the liquids are not mixed together. Pour the lemonade over crushed ice, then add the red wine. Garnish with a sprig of mint and a maraschino cherry. Good for hot days.

name: Christer Petterson
instructions: Mix and serve with crushed ice in a small rocks glass.

name: Christi's Corpse
instructions: Shake all ingredients except soda in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass half full of ice, top up with soda and give a gentle stir.

name: Christina Ricci Cocktail
description: This drink is from an Oakland University graduate student (Mark Katakowski), who in a dream was taught how to make it by the actress Christina Ricci.Pour the Scotch whisky into a whiskey sour glass filled with ice. Add the spoonful of coffee, and serve.
instructions: Pour the Scotch whisky into a whiskey sour glass filled with ice. Add the spoonful of coffee, and serve.

name: Christini Martini
instructions: Build ingredients in a champagne flute, and serve.

name: Christmas
instructions: Heat water in microwave. Mix hot chocolate in water. Add Godiva. Stir. Add marshmallows to taste.

name: Christmas Bellringer
instructions: Shake ingredients except orange twist in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass. Hold twist in front of a lighter flame and squeeze it to release a flaming burst of oils over drink, then toss twist in.

name: Christmas in a Cup
instructions: Add Dr. Pepper and spiced rum, stir, then put Aftershock in and let it mix by itself.

name: Christmas in a Cup
instructions: Add Dr. Pepper and spiced rum, stir, then put Aftershock in and let it mix by itself.

name: Christmas In The Tropics
instructions: Pour the Captain Morgan Parrot Bay coconut rum into a cup, then pour in the eggnog after. Stir it around a bit to mix it together, and serve.

ingredients.name: Captain Morgan® Parrot Bay coconut rum

name: Christmas Martini
instructions: Pour the gin, dry vermouth and peppermint schnapps into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a candy cane, and serve.

name: Christmas Tree Water
instructions: Place one part dry gin into a cocktail glass. Do not bruise the gin! Carefully add two parts sprite. Do not bruise the sprite. Optionally, add a dash of cayan pepper for added flavor. Add 3 tablespoons of dry ice for that mystical, yet strangely, psycho effect.

name: Chronic
instructions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail glass, stir, and serve.

name: Chrysanthemum Cocktail
instructions: Pour the vermouth and benedictine into a mixing glass half-filled with cracked ice. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Add the Pernod, garnish with an orange twist, and serve.

name: Chuhai
instructions: Pour the shochu and soda water into a cocktail glass. Add the lemon juice, and serve. Add lime or orange juice as an optional extra.

name: Chum
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a twist of lemon.

name: Chump
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into an Irish coffee mug filled with crushed ice.

name: Chunnel Cocktail
instructions: Pour the Grand Marnier, gin, vermouth and bitters into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Church Lady Martini
instructions: Pour the gin, vermouth and orange juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon, lime and orange peels, and serve.

name: Ciclon and Coke
instructions: Pour the Bacardi Ciclon rum over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Add Coke to fill or to taste, and serve.

name: Ciel
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cigar Lover's Martini
instructions: Combine ingredients with ice in a mixing glass and stir to chill. Strain into a chilled martini glass, garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Cinco de Mayo
instructions: Shake well with lots of ice. Strain into glass. Garnish with fresh lime wedge if desired.

name: Cinnamon Bloody Mary
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a shaker. Pour over ice and add a pickle spear and a pickled mushroom for garnish.

name: Cinnamon Caramel Apple
instructions: Pour the shot of Goldschlager in a cocktail glass, fill with 1/2 glass of the chilled apple cider, and add 1 shot of caramel liqueur. Stir to mix.

name: Cinnamon Nuts and Cream
instructions: Pour ingredients into a stainless steel shaker over ice,shake until completely cold then strain into a chilled stemmed glass or Rocks glass filled with ice.

name: Cinnamon Road
instructions: Shake with ice. Serve with a slice of dried apple.

name: Cinnamon Stick
instructions: Pour goldschlager into a glass. Add apple juice, mix and serve.

name: Cinnamon Stick #2
instructions: Fill and old fashioned glass about 1/3 to 1/2 full of ice. Pour 2 oz. Aftershock over ice. Top off with 4-6 oz. 7-Up. Lightly stir.

name: Cinnamon Toast
instructions: Rim an irish coffee cup or glass with sugar and cinnamon. Add hot cider and rum, and serve.

name: Cinnamon Toast
instructions: Rim an old-fashioned glass with sugar and cinnamon. Add hot cider and rum, and serve.

name: Cinnamon Toast Crunch
instructions: In a moderately sized glass (about 8 to 12 oz or so) pour in finely crushed ice, followed by the cinnamon schnapps and vanilla vodka.

name: Cinzano Cocktail
instructions: Stir ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Cioccolato e Cocco
instructions: Mix all ingredients thoroughly and pour in glass.

name: Circular Incision
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a twist of lemon.

name: Circus Peanut
instructions: Shake well to incorporate the Advocaat and strain into a glass.

name: Cit on Fire
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a sour glass.

name: Citrini
instructions: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake vigorously. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass. Garnish with a thin slice of orange, and serve.

name: Citron Cheese Cake
instructions: Muddle lemon wedge with vanilla, cinnamon and sugar syrup. Add Frangelico, Absolut Citron and cream. Shake with ice. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a mess of lemon zest.

name: Citron Splash Martini
description: Citron Splash Martini is an excellent martini for beginners and goes down easily! Discovered at Amsterdam's Martini Bar in Phoenix, AZ.Combine the Absolut Citron, Triple sec and juice of 1/3 lemon (~3/4 oz juice) in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake. Use the lemon to wet the edge of a chilled martini or cocktail glass, and dip the glass in sugar to coat the rim. Strain the mixture into the cocktail glass, garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.
instructions: Combine the Absolut Citron, Triple sec and juice of 1/3 lemon (~3/4 oz juice) in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake. Use the lemon to wet the edge of a chilled martini or cocktail glass, and dip the glass in sugar to coat the rim. Strain the mixture into the cocktail glass, garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Citrus Cactus
instructions: Shake and strain into a double-cocktail glass filled with crushed ice.

name: Citrus Eden
description:
A very herbal tasting drink, yet sweet, cold & refreshing. A blend of citrus with a distinctive green hue that tantalizes ones senses while everyone else turns green with envy of such a pretty drink.Very Simple, makes between 3 - 5 drinks:

Fill average to large blender with ice (yet leave enough room to get the lid on!)

Pour in Svedka Clementine (or citrus flavored vodka) over the ice and fill between the quarter & half mark on the blender's mesurement collumn. 

Splash in some orange juice until the fluid surrounding the ice resembles an orange juice shade of yellow.   *(more or less depending upon taste)

Pluck leaves from the sprigs of mint & lemon verbena/lemon balm leaving the top most tiny leaves on the sprig. Do not throw away the sprig because it is a nice garnish to plant into the drink next to a straw for some added asthetic.

Add leaves of both mint & lemon verbena/lemon balm. to the top of mixture already in blender. Allow your blender to pulse/mix vigorously until the mixture resembles an avocado colored slush. Pour into your favorite long stem glass (margarita or costume wine glasses look best) and adorn with a lime slice and/or the sprigs from mint or lemon verbena/lemon balm. for a professional touch, a cocktail umbrella or a colored straw also sets this drink off well.
instructions:
Very Simple, makes between 3 - 5 drinks:

Fill average to large blender with ice (yet leave enough room to get the lid on!)

Pour in Svedka Clementine (or citrus flavored vodka) over the ice and fill between the quarter & half mark on the blender's mesurement collumn. 

Splash in some orange juice until the fluid surrounding the ice resembles an orange juice shade of yellow.   *(more or less depending upon taste)

Pluck leaves from the sprigs of mint & lemon verbena/lemon balm leaving the top most tiny leaves on the sprig. Do not throw away the sprig because it is a nice garnish to plant into the drink next to a straw for some added asthetic.

Add leaves of both mint & lemon verbena/lemon balm. to the top of mixture already in blender. Allow your blender to pulse/mix vigorously until the mixture resembles an avocado colored slush. Pour into your favorite long stem glass (margarita or costume wine glasses look best) and adorn with a lime slice and/or the sprigs from mint or lemon verbena/lemon balm. for a professional touch, a cocktail umbrella or a colored straw also sets this drink off well.

name: Citrus Martini
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Citrus Mist Colada
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender; blend until thick. Pour into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry and a slice of lime, and serve.

name: Citrus Neon
instructions: Pour the citrus vodka, blue curacao, Midori melon liqueur and sour mix into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass, top with 7-up, and serve.

name: Citrus Tango
instructions: Pour two shots of citrus or lemon vodka into the glass. Add pineapple juice and then half a can of orange soda. Mix well.

name: Citrus Twist on Fire
instructions: Pour both ingredients into an old-fashioned glass 1/4 filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and serve.

name: City Slicker
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Clamato Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

name: Claremont
instructions: Muddle an orange slice and a cherry with bitters and curacao in the bottom of an old-fashioned glass. Remove the orange rind, and add bourbon, ice, and soda. Garnish with the remaining orange slice and cherry, and serve.

name: Clarence
instructions: Pour all ingredients over ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake and strain into a brandy snifter, and serve.

name: Claret Lemonade
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a wine goblet over ice. Garnish with a lemon wheel, and serve.

name: Claridge Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Class Act
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker of ice, shake, then strain into a rocks glass full of ice. Drinker will have to constantly mix the drink in his glass as the Advocaat will settle.

name: Classic Cocktail
instructions: Prepare an old-fashioned glass by rubbing a slice of lemon around the rim and dipping it into powdered sugar. Pour the brandy, curacao, maraschino liqueur and lemon juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into the prepared glass, and serve.

name: Classic Peach Daiquiri
instructions:
Combine in blender with ice until smooth. Serve in a large cocktail glass.

Optional: add 1/4 canned peach with juice.

name: Classic Sidecar
instructions: Take a lemon wedge, notch a slice into the middle and use it to moisten the rim of a chilled cocktail glass. Frost the moistened outer rim of the glass with superfine sugar. Shake ingredients together with cracked ice and strain into prepared cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon twist, and serve.

name: Classic Walker
instructions: Take an old-fashioned glass and place 2 thin slices of lime and ice into it. Add some perrier to extract the essence of the lime. Add Johnnie Walker Black, with lime juice to finish it off. Add a stirrer and serve.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Black Label Scotch whisky

name: Classy Razz
instructions: Pour liqueur into the bottom of a champagne flute. Add ginger ale, then raspberries.

name: Clear Lemonade
instructions: Stir ingredients together in an old-fashioned glass. Add shaved ice and serve.

name: Clementine Martini
instructions: Add the vodka, orange curacao and triple sec to a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a martini cocktail glass. Float the cranberry juice, then the soda water, the the ginger ale. Garnish with a clementine wedge (if available) or a lightly flamed orange peel twist, and serve.

name: Cleveland Steamer
instructions: Mix the first amount of Bacardi 151 with vodka and margarita mix. Layer the last amount of Bacardi on top and light on fire before serving.

name: Climax
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Clint's Cosmopolitan
instructions: Combine all ingredients in an iced cocktail shaker. Shake vigorously then strain into a cocktail glass (sugared rim optional) and garnish with a lime wedge before serving.

name: Cloister
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Closure
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake gently, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cloud Walker
instructions: Pour into an old-fashioned glass filled with broken ice. Add a lime slice, and serve.

name: Cloudberry Cocktail
instructions: Rim a cocktail glass with pineapple juice and sugar. Shake ingredients and strain into the glass. Garnish with a cherry and an orange slice.

name: Cloudberry Dream
instructions: Add ingredients to an ice-filled old-fashioned glass, stir, and garnish with cranberries.

name: Clove Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Clover Club Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Clover Club Royal
instructions: Shake well and strain into a double-cocktail glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a slice of lemon, and serve.

name: Clover Leaf Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except mint) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the sprig of mint and serve.

name: Club Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a martini or cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel and a strawberry, and serve.

name: Club Cuba
instructions: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass filled with ice, stir and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

name: Club Paradise
instructions: Blend ingredients in a bar blender at low speed until smooth. Pour into a snifter and garnish with a sprinkle of nutmeg and a slice of banana.

name: Cobalt Kiss
instructions: Mix vodka and blue curacao with 7-Up in an old fashioned glass over ice. Add lime juice. Stir. Garnish with twist of lime, and serve.

name: Cobra
instructions: Pour ingredients into a rocks or old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Garnish with a lime wheel or squeeze, and serve.

name: CoCito
instructions: Mix coconut milk, sweetened condensed milk, cream of coconut, cinnamon, nutmeg, and eggnog in blender and blend for 1 minute. Slowly pour in coconut rum and mix until desired strength.

name: Cock-A-Bendy
instructions: Shake with a glassful of broken ice and pour unstrained into an old-fashioned glass. Add a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Cocky Apple Pucker Fucker
instructions: Pour all ingrdients (except sloe gin) into a cocktail shaker with a little ice. Shake and pour into an old-fashioned glass. Pour sloe gin on top slowly. Squeeze slice of lemon or lime over top. Serve with straw.

name: Coco Amor
instructions: Pour the Cocoribe, amaretto almond liqueur and lemon juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a sugar-rimmed cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Coco Berry
instructions: Muddle the raspberries and chambord in a mixing glass. Add ice, rum, and creme de cacao. Stir to chill, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Coco Channel
instructions: Shake all with ice, serve in lowball over ice, or neat in a martini glass.

name: Coco Cognac
instructions: Pour the ingredients in a shaker with ice cubes, shake, and pour in a cocktail glass.

name: Coco Martini
description: Coco Martini is a popular recipe in Columbia, Missouri where Jake Maulin, a freelance college bartender concocted it.Pour Bacardi Coco, Kahlua and brown creme de cacao into a mixing glass. Shake, and strain into a cocktail/martini glass. Spiral chocolate syrup from the center to the outer rim. Garnish with a chocolate spiral, and serve.
instructions: Pour Bacardi Coco, Kahlua and brown creme de cacao into a mixing glass. Shake, and strain into a cocktail/martini glass. Spiral chocolate syrup from the center to the outer rim. Garnish with a chocolate spiral, and serve.

name: Coco's Cocktail
instructions: Mix in a shaker and serve with a slice of lime.

name: Cocoa Chanel
instructions: Shake with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Coconut Batida
instructions: Shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Strain into an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Coconut Brandy Bowl
instructions:
1. Slice off the eyes of the coconuts; drain and save the milk. 

2. Gouge out the meat of the coconuts; saving as much milk from that as possible. 

3. Combine the brandy, banana liqueur, and all the coconut milk in a blender with the crushed ice. Blend at a high speed for 15 seconds. Serve the drink in the two coconut shells.

name: Coconut Breeze
instructions: Combine all three ingredients in a cocktail shaker along with store bought ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Serve.

name: Coconut Cream Pie
instructions: Combine all ingredients into a shaker with ice shake & strain into cocktail glass.

name: Coconut Dream
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Coconut Fusion
instructions: Fill a cocktail glass 2/3 with ice. Add ingredients, stir, and serve.

name: Coconut Gin
instructions: Shake and strain into a champagne saucer filled with crushed ice.

name: Coconut Milk
instructions: Pour a shot of Malibu coconut rum into the bottom of a cordial glass. Top up with milk (the colder the better), stir, and serve.

name: Coconut Monkey
instructions: Shake and strain into a double-cocktail glass filled with crushed ice.

name: Coconut Pie
instructions: Serve with or without ice.

name: Coconut Telegraph
instructions: Blend ingredients in a bar blender. Pour into an old-fashioned glass.

name: Coconut Tequila
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a blender with half a cup of crushed ice. Blend for 15 seconds. Pour into a medium-sized cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Coconut Toastie
instructions: Combine all ingredients (except coconut) in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute, garnish with shredded coconut, and serve.

name: Cocopolitan
description: A tasty puerto rican recipe, similar to that of the Cosmopolitan although with coconut vodka instead. Combine in a shaker all the ingredients and shake. Chill a cocktail glass, pour and serve with a twist of lime.
instructions: Combine in a shaker all the ingredients and shake. Chill a cocktail glass, pour and serve with a twist of lime.

name: Coctel Algeria
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Coffee Alexander
instructions: Shake and strain into a champagne saucer. Sprinkle with grated chocolate, and serve.

name: Coffee Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a small wine or port glass. Dust with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Coffee Crisp
instructions: Add four ingredients and shake well, pour into old-fashioned glass. Do not use ice.

name: Coffee Crisp Shot
instructions: Pour first three in order, layer Bailey's on top.

name: Coffee Flip
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

name: Coffee Grasshopper
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

name: Coffee Keokee
instructions: Combine ingredients in an Irish coffe mug.

name: Coffee Lover's Martini
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with coffee beans, and serve.

name: Coffee Old-Fashioned
instructions: Dissolve the instant coffee in the water in an old-fashioned glass. Gradually stir in the sugar, the bitters and the bourbon whiskey. Add ice, and top with club soda. Garnish with a maraschino cherry and a slice of orange, and serve.

name: Coffee Orloff
instructions: Pre-warm a coffee mug, then add Tia Maria and fill with coffee. Stir, then layer Creme de Grand Marnier on top.

name: Coffee Royale
instructions: Pour the coffee into an Irish coffee cup or glass. Add the sugar, and stir to dissolve. Add the brandy, stir again. Pour the cream over the back of a teaspoon over the top of the drink so that it floats, and serve.

name: Coffee Sour
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.

name: Coffee Stick
instructions: Pour the Kahlua coffee liqueur, Sambuca and cream into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes, and shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Coffin Nail
instructions: Build over ice in an old-fashioned glass.

name: Cognac Coupling
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashined glass 1/2 filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Cognac Flip
instructions: Shake well all ingredients in a shaker. Strain into cocktail glass and grate some nutmeg on top.

name: Cognac Mint Frappe
instructions: Mix and pour into a champagne saucer filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a sprig of mint, and serve with a short straw.

name: Cognac Zoom
instructions: Dissolve honey in water and allow to cool. Shake with cognac and cream and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Cointreau Caress
instructions: Pour both ingredients into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with grated dark chocolate sprinkled over the top, and serve.

name: Cokahlua
instructions: Build over crushed ice in a cordial glass. Garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon.

name: Cokahlualicious
instructions: Mix the kahlua and coconut liqueur, poor over crushed ice, and sprinkle a pinch of cinnamon on the top. Voila! You can also put this in a blender if you so desire.

name: Coko's Passion
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, pour into glass and add two cherries.

name: Cola Chup-a-Chup
instructions: Shake all ingredients except bitters in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass. Add the 2 dashes of Angostura Bitters.

name: Colby's Delight
instructions: Pour all ingredients into an old-fashioned glass 1/2 filled with ice cubes. Garnish with an apple slice, and serve.

name: Cold Comfort Martini
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Cold Deck Cocktail
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cold Duck Cocktail
instructions: Stir ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Cold Porridge
instructions: Shake and strain into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice.

name: Colditz
instructions: Shake and strain into an old-fashioned glass half-filled with broken ice. Add the cola, and serve.

name: Colonial Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.

name: Colonial Rummer
instructions: Add crushed ice halfway up the glass. Add liquor ingredients. Stir with swizzle stick. Garnish with fruit. Relax and sip.

name: Colony Club Martini
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange twist, and serve.

name: Colony Room Cocktail
instructions: Place a dash of ricard into a cocktail glass and swill to coat the inside. Pour out the excess. Chill the gin, vermouth and bitters by stirring with ice, and strain into the prepared glass. Serve.

name: Colorado Bulldog
instructions: In a shaker mix Vodka, Kahlua, and milk. Pour into a rocks glass and add a splash of Coca-Cola.

name: Colorado Pug
instructions: Fill glass with ice. Pour in Kahlua and Bailey's Irish Cream. Top with club soda. Stir and serve.

name: Columbia Cocktail
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Columbus Cocktail
instructions: Shake briefly with a glassful of crushed ice, and strain into a double-cocktail glass. Add a slice of lime and serve.

name: Combat
instructions: Blend all ingredients (EXCEPT BEER) in a shaker with ice, shake well. Pour into Brandy Snifter (ice incl.) Top off with Beer.

name: Combo
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

name: Combustible Edison
instructions: In a shaker full of cracked ice, combine Campari and lemon juice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Heat brandy in a chaffing dish. When warm, ignite the brandy and pour in a flaming stream into the cocktail glass.

name: Comfort Dry Manhattan
instructions: Combine Vermouth, Southern Comfort, and ice in a glass and stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Comfort Manhattan
instructions: Combine the vermouth, Southern Comfort and bitters with 2 - 3 ice cubes in a mixing glass. Stir gently, don't bruise the spirits and cloud the drink. Place a maraschino cherry in a chilled cocktail glass and strain the whiskey mixture over the cherry. Rub the cut edge of a twist of lemon peel over the rim of the glass and twist it over the drink to release the oils. Then drop it in, and serve.

name: Comfort Tiger
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Comfortable Brother
instructions: Pour both ingredients into an old-fashioned glass. Stir briefly, and serve.

name: Comfortable Coffee Cocktail
instructions: Heat ingredients in a pan on the stove until they are simmering. Pour into a pre-warmed mug and garnish with cinnamon.

name: Comfortable Fuzz
instructions: Put the schnapps and Southern Comfort in a glass with some ice cubes and fill the rest of the glass with equal amounts of orange juice and cranberry juice.

name: Comfortable Mariah
instructions: Fill glass with ice, add all liquid ingredients and mix well. Garnish with a lime wheel and cherry.

name: Comfortable Nut
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Comfortable White
instructions: Pour Southern Comfort in glass and fill with white grape juice.

name: Comforting Coffee
instructions: Add bourbon, creme de cacao and Southern Comfort to an Irish coffee mug. Fill with coffee, leaving room to float the cream on top. Garnish with a sprinkle of cocoa powder.

name: Comforting Coffee
instructions: Pour the coffee into an Irish coffee glass or cup. Add the Southern Comfort, bourbon whiskey, and creme de cacao, and stir well. Pour the cream carefully over the back of a teaspoon on top of the drink so that it floats, and serve.

name: Comforting Tiger
instructions: In a mixing glass, half-filled with crushed ice, combine the Brandy, Southern Comfort, and Vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.

name: Commodore Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Commonwealth
instructions: Stir and strain into a brandy snifter.

name: Communicator
instructions: Pour all of the ingredients into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

name: Compadre
instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Conca de Fuego
instructions: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry on a stick, and serve.

name: Conchita
instructions: Buid over ice in a rocks glass.

name: Coney Island Iced Tea
instructions: Pour rum and iced tea into a chilled cocktail glass. Add a splash of lemon juice, and serve.

name: Confidence Builder
description: Confidence builder was invented by Kerry Jones for a man who asked for a drink to boost his confidence at a club on night. It seemed to pick up as a popular drink as time went on.Mix vodka, dry, and sweet vermouth in a cocktail shaker, then shake with ice cubes thoroughly. Add a shot of orange juice to a whisky glass and fill halfway with lime soda. Pour the martini-like mix into the glass, including some ice, then stir the drink. Garnish with an orange slice, cherry, or other citrus fruit.
instructions: Mix vodka, dry, and sweet vermouth in a cocktail shaker, then shake with ice cubes thoroughly. Add a shot of orange juice to a whisky glass and fill halfway with lime soda. Pour the martini-like mix into the glass, including some ice, then stir the drink. Garnish with an orange slice, cherry, or other citrus fruit.

name: Confirmed Bachelor
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Conga Line
instructions: Shake and serve.

name: Connecticut Bulldog
instructions: Shake and strain into a champagne saucer filled with crushed ice.

name: Connoisseur's Treat
instructions: Stir and strain into a brandy snifter.

name: Conqueror
instructions: Build over ice in the glass. Stir well.

name: Conquistador
instructions: Shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Continental
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

name: Coo Coo
instructions: In a blender, combine ingredients with ice and enjoy!

name: Cooch Behar
instructions: Pour into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice, and serve.

name: Cookie Tosser
instructions: Throw all ingredients together in an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Cool Cucumber
instructions: Put a few ice-cubes in a longdrink glass, and put a little lemon juice in it. Then cut a cucumber in two halves and cut off a part. Get the seeds out and put it in the glass as well. Shake in a well cooled down bottle of champagne and let the glass stand in the refrigerator for a while. Then it's ready to drink.

name: Cool Paradise
instructions: Combine all of the ingredients in an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Cool Yule Martini
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Coolwater
instructions: Fill the cup three quarters of the way with ice. Pour Grey Goose about halfway. Then add the Hpnotiq to a little less than a quarter of the way up. Fill the rest with Monster. Give it a quick stir. Enjoy!

name: Cooperstown Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except mint) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the sprig of mint and serve.

name: Copenheering
instructions:
Chill the glass, then fill it with crushed ice. 

Mix the cherry brandy and the vodka together, and pour into the glass. Garnish with lemon peel.

name: Copper Rivet
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Coral Queensland
instructions: Add vodka to a Champagne flute, add a dash of limoncello (to taste), and a dash of blue curacao (to taste). Fill the glass with lemonade. Add ice if desired, and serve.

name: Coral Reef
instructions: Pour vodka, tequila, and blue curacao over ice and shake. Slowly add sour mix until bright torquoise, mix again, and serve.

name: Corcovado
instructions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail glass and fill with crushed ice. Garnish with a slice of lime and a cherry. Serve with short straws.

name: Corey's Oatmeal Cookie
instructions: Pour Bailey's irish cream and butterscotch schnapps into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Add a couple of dashes of cinnamon. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Dust wth cinnamon, and serve.

name: Corey's Pomtonic
instructions: Pour the Bombay Sapphire gin and POM pomegranate juice into a rocks glass filled with ice cubes. Fill with tonic water, stir and serve.

name: Corkscrew
instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, peach schnapps, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.

name: Corn Romeo
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass.

name: Cornell Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cornhusker Deluxe
instructions: Add ingredients to glass and stir. Sip to enjoy maximum flavor.

name: Corniche
instructions: Shake and strain into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice. Garnish with a sugar dipped strawberry.

name: Coronado Cocktail
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Coronation Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Corpse Reviver
instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Corpse Reviver #3
instructions: Stir over ice cubes in a mixing glass, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve with a glass of ice water.

name: Corrupt the Righteous
instructions: Mix and serve in a cocktail glass.

name: Cosmalize
instructions: Shake with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cosmic Kool-Aid
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail glass. Drop in two maraschino cherries, and serve.

name: Cosmo
instructions: Pour the vodka, triple sec, cranberry juice and lime juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cosmo Katie
instructions: Chill cocktail glass. Pour ingredients with ice into mixer and shake well. Serve straight up with a cherry.

name: Cosmo Killer
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass and serve.

name: Cosmo Kurant
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail or martini glass. Garnish with a lime wedge on the rim, and serve.

name: Cosmobellini
instructions: Pour vodka and cointreau into a shaker. Squeeze in the juice of one wedge of lime. Add peach puree, a splash of cranberry juice, and shake. Strain into a cocktail glass, top with prosecco and serve.

name: Cosmonaut
instructions: Mix really well and serve.

name: Cosmopolitan #7
description: Combining the orange flavor of the vodka and of the liqueur gives a strong but pleasent citrus taste as well as a nice scent.  The cranberry juice, while adding needed color, gives another fruitier taste.  Combined with the lime (whether in the shaker or as a garnish) the result is a great effect on the nose and palate.Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice.  Shake hard for only a few seconds. You can add two lime wedges to the shaker or add a lime slice to garnish at the end.  Strain into a cocktail glass and serve.  Unless you're doing multiple Cosmopolitans at a time I suggest replacing the ice after every one; that way the melted ice doesn't damage the flavor of the drink.
instructions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice.  Shake hard for only a few seconds. You can add two lime wedges to the shaker or add a lime slice to garnish at the end.  Strain into a cocktail glass and serve.  Unless you're doing multiple Cosmopolitans at a time I suggest replacing the ice after every one; that way the melted ice doesn't damage the flavor of the drink.

name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
instructions: Shake vodka, triple sec, lime and cranberry juice vigorously in a shaker with ice. Strain into a martini glass, garnish with a lime wedge on the rim, and serve.

name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail #2
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake briefly and pour into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime twist.

name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail #3
instructions: Stir ingredients on ice and strain into a martini glass.

name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail #4
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail or martini shaker with ice and 2 squeezed lime wedges. Shake violently for 10 seconds. Strain into a martini or cocktail glass garnished with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail #5
instructions: Combine the Smirnoff vodka, triple sec, fresh lime juice and cranberry juice in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a frosted cocktail glass. Rub the rim with orange zest (if desired) and drop it into the glass. Serve.

name: Cosmopolitan Cocktail #6
instructions: Shake vodkas, triple sec, sweet and sour, lime and cranberry juice vigorously in a shaker with ice. Strain into a martini glass, garnish with a lime wedge, and serve.

name: Cosmopolitan Delight
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and serve over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Top with a splash of red wine. Garnish with fresh fruit, and serve.

name: Cosmopolitan Heston Bar Style (Indiana)
description: This recipe comes from a super club in La Porte, Indiana (about 50 minutes outside of Chicago). Heston Bar is known for its prime rib, handcut steaks and fresh seafood. Winner of the Wine Spectators Wine Award.Pour all ingredients into a stainless steel cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake very well and strain into a chilled martini / cocktail glass. A sheet of ice should form when the cosmo is strained into the glass.
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a stainless steel cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake very well and strain into a chilled martini / cocktail glass. A sheet of ice should form when the cosmo is strained into the glass.

name: Cosmopolitan Martini
instructions: Pour all ingredients in mixing glass half filled with ice, shake and strain into chilled martini glass.

name: Cosmoquila
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain.

name: Cosmos
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Cosmotequila
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cossack Charge
instructions: Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender and pour into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Cossack Cocktail
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Coterie
instructions: Stir and strain into a cordial glass.

name: Cotillion Cocktail
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cotton Candy
instructions: Combine ingredients with ice in a blender. Blend well, pour into a cocktail glass and serve.

name: Cotton Candy #2
instructions: Pour the Phillips Butter Ripple schnapps into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Fill with milk, add a touch of grenadine, and serve.

name: Cotton Candy #4
instructions: Pour the Malibu rum and peach schnapps into a cocktail glass. Fill with pink lemonade, or add to taste, and serve.

name: Cotton Club
instructions: Pour the Kahlua and vodka into a cocktail glass. Stir then add shaved ice. Top with whipped cream and garnish with a coffee bean, and serve.

name: Count Stroganoff
instructions: Pour the vodka, creme de cacao and lemon juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a half-slice of lemon, and serve.

name: Cowboy Cocktail
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cowboy Killer
instructions: Pour tequila, bailey's irish cream and butterscotch schnapps into a cocktail glass. Add ice and half-and-half. Pour into a shaker, shake to mix and pour back into the glass. Garnish with a cherry, and serve.

name: Cowboy's Comet
instructions: Pour rye whiskey over ice, then add cola, southern comfort, and lime.

name: Cowgirl Quencher
instructions: Pour the Malibu coconut rum and DeKuyper Peachtree schnapps into a margarita glass filled with crushed ice. Fill the rest of the glass with equal parts of orange and pineapple juice. Add a splash of grenadine, top with an orange slice and a cherry and serve.

name: Cox in the Morning
instructions: Chill Orange Crystal Light, add Malibu. Perfect for any day this summer!

ingredients.name: Crystal Light® Sunrise Classic Orange mix

name: Cracked Chandelier
instructions: Pour all ingredients into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Garnish with a slice of both lemon and lime, and serve.

name: Cracklin' Rosie
instructions: Shake ingredients and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry on a stick, and serve.

name: Cramit
instructions: Fill and stir, they love the name.

name: Cran It
instructions: Combine ingredients in a rocks glass.

name: Cran-Collins
instructions: Put three cubes of ice in a glass. Pour in Vodka, Cranberry Juice, and Collins Mix. Stir and enjoy.

name: Cran-Henny
instructions: Pour hennessy cognac into an old fashioned glass with cranberry juice and ice. Stir lightly and serve.

name: Cran-Razz
instructions: Place ice cubes in glass. Add cranberry juice, then orange vodka.

name: Cranapple Cocktail
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Cranapple Martini
instructions: Add vodka and DeKuyper Sour Apple Pucker to an ice-filled cocktail or martini shaker. Splash enough cranberry juice to give red tint. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Cranbeery
instructions: Combine ingredients in a beer mug.

name: Cranberry Blast
instructions: Pour all ingredients over cubed or crushed ice, stir well and serve!

name: Cranberry Cooler
instructions: Mix ingredients together in a large container and freeze for approximately 24 hours. Pour into cocktail glasses when ready to serve.

name: Cranberry Gin
instructions: Shake gin and cran-raspberry juice with cracked ice in a cocktail shaker; pour into a martini glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Cranberry Kiss
description: This is a fruity, very delicious drink in which all ingredients blend perfectly. It tastes great for summer get-togethers as well as seasonal celebrations.Make by the glass for a few guests or in a shaker or pitcher for a large party. Serve in a cocktail glass, garnishing the glass rim with a half slice of fresh lime.
