name: Paddy's Girl
description: James Noar serves this drink when the ladies request it at his parties. It is always a success, as no one has ever said they didn't like it. The favor takes the typical Irish Coffee and really kicks it up to the Moon. The addition of the Godiva, and the espresso into the mix is nothing short of spectacular. This drink, when served, has been proven to make the party go well into the next morning, and usually means breakfast will be served.Pour ingredients into a blender filled with crushed ice. Blend until smooth and creamy, and pour into a margarita glass, Sprinkle chocolate shavings on top, and serve.
instructions: Pour ingredients into a blender filled with crushed ice. Blend until smooth and creamy, and pour into a margarita glass, Sprinkle chocolate shavings on top, and serve.

name: Paez
description: Invented by Sam Ross, bartender at Little Branch, in NYC. Featured in the New York Times Sunday Styles section on July 31, 2005.Stir ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.
instructions: Stir ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Pain d'Epices
instructions: Chill a martini glass. Pour the rum, Pedro Ximenez and Monin pain d'epices (gingerbread) syrup over ice in a mixing glass. By hand, squeeze the juice from half an orange into the glass. Stir slowly and at length. Strain into a martini glass, and serve.

name: Painkiller
instructions: Mix well in a shaker with three or four ice cubes. Strain into an old-fashioned glass, garnish with a pineapple piece, and serve.

name: Paisley Martini
instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Add a twist of lemon peel and serve.

name: Pajama Jammy Jam
instructions: Shake goldschlager, grenadine and raspberry liqueur in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass. Mix vodka and orange juice in separate container and float on top.

name: Palamino
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into the glass.

name: Pall Mall Cocktail
instructions: Stir the gin, vermouths and creme de cacao together in an old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Pall Mall Martini
instructions: Stir the gin, vermouths, creme de menthe and orange bitters together in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Palm Beach Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Palm Beacher
instructions: Pour the dark rum, amaretto and orange juice into an old-fashioned glass 3/4 filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Palmer Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Palmetto Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pamir Peach
instructions: Pour the Stoli peach vodka (Persik). Amaretto Di Saronno, orange juice and lemon juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, strain into a chilled old-fashioned glass over several ice cubes, and serve.

name: Pammy Kay
instructions: Pour the vermouth, gin, brandy and fruit juices into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pamplemousse
instructions: Shake with a glassful of broken ice and pour unstrained into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a small slice of grapefruit and a cherry.

name: Pan-Galactic Gargle Blaster #3
instructions: Place ingredients into a cocktail shaker over ice. Shake and strain into a martini cocktail glass. Consume as a shot.

name: Panama
instructions: Shake ingredients well and serve over ice.

name: Panama Cocktail
instructions: Shake well with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Panama Deluxe
instructions: Shake all ingredients together, and serve in a tumbler over ice.

name: Panama Red
instructions: Shake ingredients over ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Panamaniac
instructions: Shake all ingredients except lime twist in a cocktail shaker with ice and strain into glass. Squeeze lime peel over drink to release spray of oils and then drop it in.

name: Panther
instructions: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over several ice cubes. Stir well and serve.

name: Panther Piss
instructions: Stir the rum, triple sec and lime juice together in an old-fashioned glass 3/4 filled with ice cubes. Fill with Sprite, and serve.

name: Panther Sweat
instructions: Shake the ingredients together with crushed ice, and strain into a whiskey-sour glass. Add crushed salt to the rim of the glass if desired.

name: Panty Remover
instructions: Stir ingrediients together in a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Panty Ripper
instructions: Stir together with ice and serve in a cordial glass.

name: Papa Doble
instructions: Shake rum, grapefruit juice and sweetened lime juice with ice and pour or strain into a glass. Add a splash of grenadine and serve.

name: Paradise
instructions: Shake and strain into a champagne saucer. Garnish with the blossom of a white orchid and a cherry on a stick.

name: Paradise Punch
instructions: Pour everything in glass and stir, add cherries.

name: Paraflu Cocktail
instructions: Pour the vodka and lemon juice (to taste) into a cocktail glass filled with ice. Slowly pour the blue curacao to the bottom of the glass, and serve.

name: Paris Cocktail
instructions: Shake ingredients well with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed lemon peel, and serve.

name: Paris Hilton Cocktail
instructions: Pour vodka over ice cubes or crushed ice in a cocktail glass. Add a splash of UV orange vodka, top with mountain dew, and serve.

name: Parisian Blond Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Add a drop or two of vanilla extract on top of the cream, and serve.

name: Parisian Blonde
instructions: Shake and strain into a champagne flute. Garnish with a slice of orange.

name: Parisian Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Parisian Cocktail #2
instructions: Pour Grand Marnier, vodka, orange juice and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Parisian Pousse Cafe
instructions: Layer the ingredients in order into a pousse-cafe glass, and serve.

name: Parisienne
instructions: Stir well over ice cubes in a mixing glass. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass over a single ice cube, and serve.

name: Park Avenue
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Park Lane
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Park Paradise
instructions: Pour whisky, vermouth, maraschino and bitters into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Parma Nova
instructions: Pour all the ingredents into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake, then strain into a frosted margarita glass and serve.

name: Parrothead Martini
instructions: Pour the silver tequila, triple sec and fresh lime juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lime, and serve.

name: Party Boy
instructions: Rub a lemon slice on the edge of a whiskey sour glass. Dip the edge of the glass in sugar. Add pink lemonade and a dash of sour mix. Then add Bacardi, triple sec and Absolut Citron. Stir. Lick around the edge of the glass then take the shot.

name: Party Girl
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a shaker. Serve over ice, and garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Pascal
instructions: Pour licor 43 and midori into a cocktail glass. Fill with milk, add ice, and serve.

name: Pasini Express
description:
"I am a Martini cocktail enthusiast and I invented this variation on the classic dry Martini a few years ago. We began to drink it in the fashionable bars of Bologna, Italy; now, upon request, it can be mixed and served at the 'Inde Palais' cafe, Via dei Musei, Bologna." Dr. Stefano Pasini.Absolut 50Â° 'Red' Vodka must come straight out of a very cold freezer, the cocktail glass must be quite large and possibly extremely cold as well. Put a splash of Extra Dry Martini in the glass, shake it so to cover the walls of the glass with a film of vermouth and throw away what remains at the bottom of the glass, Pour 3 oz of Red Absolut vodka in the glass. Grind black pepper on the surface of the cocktail using an electric Peugeot mill, garnish with a Castelmadama olive but don't put any lemon whatsoever, for God's sake!

A popular variation is the substitution of the strong 50Â° Red Absolut with the more tolerable green Moskovskaya or, for the luxury-oriented, straight Belvedere.
instructions:
Absolut 50Â° 'Red' Vodka must come straight out of a very cold freezer, the cocktail glass must be quite large and possibly extremely cold as well. Put a splash of Extra Dry Martini in the glass, shake it so to cover the walls of the glass with a film of vermouth and throw away what remains at the bottom of the glass, Pour 3 oz of Red Absolut vodka in the glass. Grind black pepper on the surface of the cocktail using an electric Peugeot mill, garnish with a Castelmadama olive but don't put any lemon whatsoever, for God's sake!

A popular variation is the substitution of the strong 50Â° Red Absolut with the more tolerable green Moskovskaya or, for the luxury-oriented, straight Belvedere.

name: Passat
instructions: Pour into a champagne saucer. Garnish with a cherry and a lemon slice.

name: Passat #2
instructions: Pour everything into a shaker, and shake until frosted. Should turn a blue-grey color. Strain into a glass with or without ice. Serve.

name: Passion Chi-Chi
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in a mixer, and pour into an ice-filled glass. Good for warm days.

name: Passion Daiquiri
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Passion Lemonade
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass.

name: Passion Margarita
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with coarse salt. Garnish with a lime wheel, and serve.

name: Passion Party Punch
instructions: Add all ingredients equally. For large events quadruple the entire recipe. Serve cold, and have fun!

name: Passion Punch
instructions: Shake with a glassful of broken ice and pour unstrained into an old-fashioned glass.

name: Passion Pussy
instructions: Pour the La Grande Passion liqueur, grenadine and heavy cream into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake vigorously, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Passionate Cosmo
instructions: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with some cracked ice. Shake and pour (incl. ice) into a martini cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Passionate Kiss
instructions: Pour liquors into a mixing glass over ice. Fill with pineapple juice, stir, and strain into an old-fashioned glass. Decorate with a flag, and serve.

name: Passionate Rita
instructions: Pour all three ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Passionate Virgin
instructions: Pour 1/3 oz. tabasco sauce into a cordial glass. Add two parts of cinammon schnapps. Pierce a stemmed cherry throughout in order for it to become filled with cinnamon schnapps. Drop it into bottom of glass.

name: Patatíºs
instructions: Blend amaretto, rum and curacao. Pour into a glass with ice, add orange juice, and splash with grenadine.

name: Patel's Special
instructions: Pour shots into a cocktail glass. Add cranberry and pineapple juice, two squirts of lemon and fill the rest of the glass with ice.

name: Patrician
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a glass.

name: Patriot Missile
instructions: Pour half a bottle of Smirnoff Ice into a pint glass. Then add 3/4 oz. of grenadine along the inside of glass, so it settles at the bottom. In a separate shaker, combine 1/2 oz. Black Haus and 1/2 oz. blue curacao with ice. Shake contents and pour into a 1 oz. shot glass. Drop the shot glass into the pint glass and drink quickly.

name: Pavlova Peach
instructions: Pour the Stoli peach vodka (Persik), cranberry juice and orange juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and pour entire contents into a double old-fashioned glass with several ice cubes. Garnish with a peach slice, and serve.

name: Pawpaw Paradise
instructions: Using a papaya or mango, cut into small pieces and puree in a blender. Add the milk, rum, ice and sugar. Blend until smooth. Pour into 4oz glasses and garnish with strawberries.

name: Peach Blossom Martini
instructions: Pour the Stoli peach vodka (Persik), Dubonnet Rouge and maraschino liqueur into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of peach, and serve.

name: Peach Bullfrog
instructions: Pour ingredients into a Rocks glass filled with ice.

name: Peach Bunny
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Peach Cicel
instructions: Add the peach schnapps, vanilla schnapps, peach sherbet and sliced peach to a blender, and blend well. Pour into a cocktail glass, and top with whipped cream. Garnish with a maraschino cherry and serve.

name: Peach Daiquiri #2
instructions: Combine the peaches, lime juice, rum, schnapps, brandy, vanilla, and sugar in the blender until smooth. Slowly add the ice with the blender running and process until smooth. Serve in chilled cocktail glasses.

name: Peach Death
instructions: Serve on the rocks.

name: Peach Fuzz
instructions: Add limeade to a blender half-filled with ice cubes. Pit and slice to medium ripe peaches, and add, with the vodka, to the blender. Blend, pour into a margarita glass, and serve.

name: Peach Grenade
instructions:
In a shaker with ice, combine the schnapps and pomegranate juice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass--if using a martini glass, a sugar rim would complement this excellently.  Garnish with an orange slice or a peach slice.  The colour is gorgeous, and the flavor is an elegant diversion from the norm.

I actually use a blueberry/pomegranate cocktail to make this, because it's cheaper.  If you can't find sweetened pomegranate juice, add a half ounce of simple syrup or some sugar to sweeten.

name: Peach Margarita
instructions: Pour tequila, peach schnapps, and sweet and sour over ice in a margarita glass. Add grenadine, stir slightly, and serve.

name: Peach Martini
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass.

name: Peach Me Tender
instructions: Shake ingredients and pour into a chilled cocktail glass. Add a twist of orange.

name: Peach Melissa
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of peach, and serve.

name: Peach Mimosa
instructions: Add all ingredients into a champagne flute and stir. Garnish with a slice of peach.

name: Peach Poon
instructions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail glass. Add a Campino candy.

name: Peach Puff Martini
instructions: Mix the DeKuyper Sour Peach Liqueur and Smirnoff Raspberry Twist vodka, as well as a dash of lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite or Sierra Mist) in a martini cocktail shaker. Strain into a cocktail glass and drop in a maraschino cherry. Use a dash of maraschino cherry syrup in recipe if desired. Serve.

name: Peach Shize
instructions: Fill a blender half up with ice. Add peaches (with syrup) and tequila. Blend until frothy. Serve in a margarita glass.

name: Peach Tumbler
instructions: Stir all ingredients together with a few ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass or tumbler, and serve.

name: Peach West Indies
instructions: Peel and slice the half-peach and add with the white rum, maraschino liqueur and Rose's lime juice to a blender. Add 3-oz of crushed ice. Blend for 10-20 seconds. Strain into a champagne saucer, and serve.

name: Peachtree Square
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Peachy
instructions: Add crushed ice to the bottom of an old-fashioned/rocks glass, then pour all of the above ingredients in the same order as above. Decorate with a twisted slice of lemon on a tiny plastic sword with a sweet cherry. Serve.

name: Peachy Blue
instructions: Pour the peach schnapps and blue curacao into a mixing glass half-filled with cracked ice. Stir well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Peachy Keen
instructions: Mix ingredients together in a cocktail shaker 1/4-filled with crushed ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Peachy Keen Martini
description: By letting the grenadine fall to the bottom and floating the GM on top, you get what looks to be a wedge of fresh cut peaches.  Created by RS Jones for Capitol City Brewing Company's new martini menu, Washington DC. Enjoy!Pour vodka, peach schnapps, and pineapple juice into shaker full of ice.  Shake, strain and pour into cocktail (martini) glass.  Add a splash of grenadine so it will fall to the bottom and float the Grand Marnier on top.
instructions: Pour vodka, peach schnapps, and pineapple juice into shaker full of ice.  Shake, strain and pour into cocktail (martini) glass.  Add a splash of grenadine so it will fall to the bottom and float the Grand Marnier on top.

name: Peachy Kristy
instructions: Put ice in glass. Pour desired amount of Peach Schnapps into glass. Fill with Mountain Dew.

name: Peachy Martini
instructions: Pour the Stoli strawberry vodka (Strasberi) and peach brandy into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Peachy Sunrise
instructions: Fill glass with ice and pour in a shot of tequila and a shot of peach schnapps. Fill with orange juice and add a splash of grenadine. Mix with straw.

name: Peacock's Tail
instructions: Pour chartreuse into a frosted champagne flute. Fill half-way with crushed ice, and slightly damp down with the flat end of a barspoon. Add semi-frozen grenadine to form a layer, and fill with lemon sherbet. Sprinkle strega on top, garnish with a mint leaf and cherry, and serve with a straw.

name: Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwich
instructions: Stir ingredients together with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Peanut Butter Cup #2
instructions:
Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice, shake, strain into an old-fashioned glass straight up or on the rocks.

(Note: you can substitute any chocolate liqueur for the Godiva including dark creme de cacao, Vermeer, Bailey's Irish cream, or Cask & Creme Chocolate Temptation. If you use a cream liqueur you can cut down on the half and half.)

name: Pear Margarita
instructions: In blender, combine with ice and garnish with a lime wedge or wheel.

name: Pear Martini
instructions: Garnish with a slice of pear, and serve in a cocktail glass.

name: Peekaboo
instructions: Pour absolut kurant into a cocktail glass, and fill with orange juice.

name: Peep Show
instructions: Pour the Dubonnet, brandy, pernod and lime juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Peggy Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Peggy Martini
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a mixing glass half-filled with cracked ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pegu
instructions: Stir with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime twist.

name: Pellston Hottie
instructions: Mix the gin and DeKuyper Hot Damn! together in an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Pellston Hottie
description: The Pellston Hottie was developed at an exclusive party in Levering Michigan.  Due to a deficiency (none) of hotties in Pellston Michigan, one was created for them.  The unique flavors of the drink pay homage to the abundance of Pine trees in Pellston and the spicy culture of its people.Mix one ounce of the Gin with one ounce of Hot Damn into a cocktail glass.  Add ice for a great chilled drink.  Enjoy!
instructions: Mix one ounce of the Gin with one ounce of Hot Damn into a cocktail glass.  Add ice for a great chilled drink.  Enjoy!

name: Pendennis
instructions: Dissolve the sugar in a few drops of water, in an old-fashioned glass. Almost fill the glass with crushed ice, add the bourbon and stir well. Garnish with a twist of lemon.

name: Penetrator IV
instructions: Pour all ingredients together over 2 ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Stir and serve.

name: Pentecostal
instructions: Pour the bourbon into a whiskey sour glass. Add vodka and 7-up, stir, and serve.

name: Pepe's Flame of Love Martini
instructions:
Swirl a few drops of la ina sherry in a chilled cocktail glass and pour back out. Squeeze a strip of orange peel into the glass, flame' it with a match, then discard burnt peel. Fill the glass with ice cubes; until chilled, and remove ice. Add vodka, flame' another orange peel around the rim, then discard burnt peel. Stir gently, and serve.

By Pepe Ruiz of Beverly Hills Chasen's Restaurant.

name: Pepper Eater
instructions: Shake and strain into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice. Garnish with red pepper.

name: Pepper Jack
description:
A hint of Cherry Like Soda with a TASTEBUDS KICK from Jack Daniels. Get an OLD-FASHIONED GLASS (on the ROCKS GLASS) and fill with 2 Ice Cubes or Crushed Ice.

Add 1 Jigger (1Â½ oz) 45ml of Jack Daniels Whiskey (preferably) or any other type of BOURBON Whiskey. Has to be BOURBON!!

Add DR. PEPPER SODA-POP to taste, or fill your glass. It's personal preference how much soda-pop you will need.

STIR & Enjoy!!! Tastes Amazing !!!
instructions:
Get an OLD-FASHIONED GLASS (on the ROCKS GLASS) and fill with 2 Ice Cubes or Crushed Ice.

Add 1 Jigger (1Â½ oz) 45ml of Jack Daniels Whiskey (preferably) or any other type of BOURBON Whiskey. Has to be BOURBON!!

Add DR. PEPPER SODA-POP to taste, or fill your glass. It's personal preference how much soda-pop you will need.

STIR & Enjoy!!! Tastes Amazing !!!

name: Pepper Manhattan
instructions: Pour the Stoli pepper vodka (Pertsovka) and sweet vermouth into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Pepper Slammer
instructions: Add southern comfort to an old-fashioned glass with ice. Fill with dr pepper and serve.

name: Peppermint Beach
instructions: Mix with ice. Serve cold.

name: Peppermint Cream
instructions: Pour the creme de menthe, white creme de cacao, Frangelico hazelnut liqueur and Bailey's irish cream into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with milk, to taste. Garnish with a piece of kiwi, add a straw, and serve.

name: Peppermint Hot Chocolate
instructions: Pour the peppermint schnapps into an Irish coffee cup/mug, add the hot chocolate, and stir. Top with whipped cream, garnish with some peppermint candy, and serve.

name: Peppermint Martini
instructions: Pour both ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint, and serve.

name: Peppermint Pattie
instructions: Pour creme de cacao and the creme de menthe into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Stir and serve.

name: Peppermint Pleasure
instructions: Stir ingredients together in an old-fashioned glass over cracked ice, and serve.

name: Peppermint Stick
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.

name: Peppermint Twist
instructions: Pour the peppermint schnapps, Kahlua coffee liqueur and dark creme de cacao into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Peppertini
instructions: Pour the Stoli pepper vodka (Pertsovka) and dry vermouth into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and pour into an old-fashioned glass over several ice cubes. Garnish with an olive, and serve.

name: Pepsi-Clear
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass.

name: Peregrine's Peril
instructions: combine ingredients in a shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Peregrine's Peril
instructions: Pour the dark rum, lime juice, creme de bananes, southern comfort and lemon juice into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Perfect Classic Manhattan
description:
This recipe is for a single classic, premium Manhattan. It makes a rather large, potent double that has sipping-good flavor.
This recipe came out of many trials and errors with various premium bourbons, and proportions.  Knob Creek is perfect for a Manhattan.  Its slightly sweet flavors stand out in this drink.  Any premium sweet vermouth may be substituted.  It isn't a Manhattan without bitters.Chill martini-type cocktail glasses. (Three ice cubes and a shot or two of water will get the job done quickly.)

Put several ice cubes (not crushed) in a pitcher, or a large glass tumber. Add bourbon, vermouth, and bitters per the recipe.

Gently swirl or stir for at least 20 seconds.  Do not hurry this, and absolutely do *not* shake it.

Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Add stemmed maraschino cherry.
instructions:
Chill martini-type cocktail glasses. (Three ice cubes and a shot or two of water will get the job done quickly.)

Put several ice cubes (not crushed) in a pitcher, or a large glass tumber. Add bourbon, vermouth, and bitters per the recipe.

Gently swirl or stir for at least 20 seconds.  Do not hurry this, and absolutely do *not* shake it.

Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Add stemmed maraschino cherry.

name: Perfect Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Perfect Kiss
instructions: Pour white rum and peachtree schnapps over crushed ice in a margarita glass. Top with sprite, and gently place one half-strawberry underneath the layer of crushed ice. Serve.

name: Perfect Lady
instructions: Blend briefly with a glassful of crushed ice in a double-cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of peach.

name: Perfect Lemon Drop Martini
instructions:
Mix the Grey Goose vodka, triple sec, sugar and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker half filled with ice cubes. Shake well to make sure sugar is blended. Pour strained liquor into a sugar-rimmed martini glass and garnish with a twisted peel of lemon.

NOTE: To create a sugar-rimmed glass, take a lemon wedge and rub the drinking surface of the glass so it is barely moist. Dip the edge of the glass into sugar.

name: Perfect Manhattan
instructions: Swirl with ice to chill, pour into a cocktail glass, and garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Perfect Margarita #2
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker and shake with ice. Strain  into a chilled salt-rimmed cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Perfect Martini
instructions: Stir ingredients and strain into a frosted cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Perfect Rob Roy
instructions: Combine the scotch, sweet vermouth and dry vermouth in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, strain into a cocktail glass, and garnish with a maraschino cherry or a lemon twist.

name: Periodista
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker. Strain into a cocktail glass, add a twist of lime peel, and serve.

name: Pernod Pit
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Persimon Below
description:
"Invented in an Auckland cafe, which is the only place I've seen it. It's creation went pretty much like this: 'Ooh, persimons are cheap today. Hmm, I wonder what the juice tastes like with vodka... Hey, this is good!'. Add a bit of tweaking and you have a fine, very unique-tasting drink, if a bit sweet."Frost the rim of the of the glass. Combine ingredients in shaker and shake with crushed ice. Strain into the frosted glass with crushed ice. 

Optional: Garnish with a sprig of mint.
instructions:
Frost the rim of the of the glass. Combine ingredients in shaker and shake with crushed ice. Strain into the frosted glass with crushed ice. 

Optional: Garnish with a sprig of mint.

name: Peter Pan Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Peterborough Parallax
instructions: Pour all the ingredients into a cocktail shaker and shake for about 20 seconds. Pour over a very-crushed amount of ice in a glass of your own choice.

name: Petit Zinc
instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry or orange slice.

name: Petite Fleur
instructions: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Petticoat Lane
instructions: Combine the gin, vermouth and campari in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: PEZ
instructions: Mix ingredients together over ice in a tumbler. Shake well, and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Adjust sour mix ratio to taste.

name: Pharoah's Paradise
instructions: Fill mixing tin with ice, pineapple juice, rum, vodka, and Blue Pucker. Shake well. Strain into cocktail glass and add a splash of 7-up. Garnish with an orange slice/wedge and cherry spear.

name: Phillip Island Firewater
instructions: Stir ingredients together in an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Phillips Head
instructions: Mix everything together with lots of ice.

name: Phizzle
instructions: Combine ingredients in a red wine glass.

name: Phoebe Snow
instructions: Pour the Dubonnet, brandy and Pernod into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, and stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Phoenix
description: The Phoenix was created by Joe Svendsen in Decorah, Iowa. The drink contains all colors of the mythological bird the phoenix.  The "fire" comes from the tequila, and the sweet finish from the grenadine starts the whole process over again. The feather garnish is just a fun way to remind the drinker of the meaning of the drink.Add a few ice cubes to an old-fashioned glass, and add the tequila, orange juice, blue curacao and grenadine. Stir with a straw. Garnish with a small red, blue or orange feather on top of drink if available.
instructions: Add a few ice cubes to an old-fashioned glass, and add the tequila, orange juice, blue curacao and grenadine. Stir with a straw. Garnish with a small red, blue or orange feather on top of drink if available.

name: Physcadelic Summer
instructions: Pour the Parfait Amour, Malibu rum, Cointreau, blue curacao and grenadine into a blender with half a cup of crushed ice. Blend until smooth. Pour into a large sugar-rimmed cocktail glass. Drizzle grenadine over the top, garnish with a slice of lemon or lime, and serve.

name: Pic-Walsh
instructions: Swirl all ingredients together in a blender, pour into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Picador
instructions: Add ingredients to an old-fashioned glass. Add ice and stir.

name: Piccadilly Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Picon Whiskey
instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon or orange twist.

name: Piece of Mind
instructions: Pour the vodka and kummel into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well, garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Piedra Putamadre
instructions:
Mix all ingredients in a cordial glass and serve. 

A mexican party-hangover cure.

name: Pierce Clit
instructions: Pour at least half a shot of each ingredient into a cocktail glass, stir and serve.

name: Piggelin
instructions: Mix in a glass one-quarter filled with ice.

name: Piggelin #2
instructions: Mix in a glass one-quarter filled with ice.

name: Piggot's Preference
instructions: Pour the vermouth, Southern Comfort, light rum, Cointreau and orange bitters into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, and stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Pilgrim Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients and strain into a cocktail glass. Serve hot, or cold.

name: Pillow Mint
instructions: Pour whiskey into an old-fashioned glass, and add kahlua. Splash the mint schnapps, stir, and serve.

name: Pimp & Hoe
instructions: Pour the liquor into a cocktail glass. Add the orange and lemon juice, stir briefly, and serve.

name: Pina Rita
instructions: Shake ingredients over ice, and strain into a sugar-rimmed margarita glass with shaved ice. Garnish with a cherry and a pineapple slice.

name: Pina Vina
instructions: Blend with a glassful of crushed ice in a blender until smooth. Pour into a goblet, and garnish with a pineapple chunk and a slice of lemon.

name: Pinata
instructions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake until frothy. Pour into 1-2 chilled martini cocktail glasses, and serve.

name: Pine-Orgy
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass.

name: Pineapple Buganda
instructions: Cut the pineapple into small pieces, enough for two cups. Combine with everything else in a blender until smooth and thick. Serve in whiskey-sour glasses and garnish with mint sprigs and maraschino cherries.

name: Pineapple Daiquiri
instructions: Prepare in a blender with crushed ice. Pour into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pineapple Francine
instructions: Blend everything with a cupful of ice until desired smoothness is reached. Add ice if necessary. Pour into glasses.

name: Pineapple Fuck-Me-Up
instructions: Pour Bacardi 151 into a cocktail glass. Add pineapple juice, a splash of triple sec, and serve.

name: Pineapple Hornblower
instructions: Shake and strain into a double-cocktail glass filled with crushed ice.

name: Pineapple Hunk
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass.

name: Pineapple Martini
instructions: Pour into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake vigorously for a few seconds; strain into a martini cocktail glass, and serve.

ingredients.name: Captain Morgan® Parrot Bay pineapple rum

name: Pineapple Midori Colada
instructions: Shake over ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and serve.

name: Pineapple Rum Cassis
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Pineapple Splash
instructions: Fill a 16 oz. glass with ice, add 1 shot peach schnapps, 1 shot vodka. Fill half with pineapple juice and top it off with orange juice. Mix with spoon or straw and enjoy.

name: Pineapple Upside-Down Cake Martini
description: The vanilla vodka lends the cake-like flavor to the juice. The grenadine sinks to the bottom. It even looks like a pineapple up-side-down cake.Shake pineapple juice and vanilla vodka with ice in a tumbler. Pour into a martini cocktail glass. Add dash of grenadine, and serve.
instructions: Shake pineapple juice and vanilla vodka with ice in a tumbler. Pour into a martini cocktail glass. Add dash of grenadine, and serve.

name: Pineappleless Pineapple Juice
instructions: Pour southern comfort to the first line of a 16 oz. solo brand plastic cup. Add bacardi 151 rum, 7-up, orange juice, and coca-cola. Swirl briefly around in the cup and serve.

name: Pineau Martini
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Ping-Pong Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pinglan
instructions: Shake milk, irish cream and pisang ambon. Pour into a cocktail glass filled with crushed ice, and serve.

name: Pink Almond
instructions: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with fruit, and serve

name: Pink California Sunshine
instructions: Pour the champagne into a cocktail glass. Add the orange juice and creme de cassis.

name: Pink Clyt
instructions: Shake in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Pour into an old-fashioned glass, garnish with a cherry, and serve.

name: Pink Creole
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Pink Daiquiri
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Pink Diamond
description: As served at Whitelaw Hotel in South Beach Florida.Combine all ingredients with ice in a cocktail shaker and shake vigorously. "Paint" a large martini / wide rimmed glass with cold, thick fudge from a squeeze bottle. Start at the bottom of a very dry glass and spin the stem while moving the stream of fudge up to the top rim. Strain contents of shaker into painted glass. Then float a swirl of fudge on the top of this, and serve.
instructions: Combine all ingredients with ice in a cocktail shaker and shake vigorously. "Paint" a large martini / wide rimmed glass with cold, thick fudge from a squeeze bottle. Start at the bottom of a very dry glass and spin the stem while moving the stream of fudge up to the top rim. Strain contents of shaker into painted glass. Then float a swirl of fudge on the top of this, and serve.

name: Pink Drink
instructions: Pour vodka, galliano, cointreau, grenadine and milk into a cocktail shaker, shake and pour into a cocktail glass. Add a squirt of cream on top, and serve.

name: Pink Elephant
instructions: Pour grenadine into a brandy snifter, and swirl so that it coats most of the surface of the glass. Pour out the grenadine briskly, and add gin.

name: Pink Fingers
instructions: Shake and strain into a frosted cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of banana and a maraschino cherry.

name: Pink Fix
instructions: Pour ingredients into a shaker half-filled with ice. Shake vigorously, and pour into a lowball glass. Garnish to taste.

name: Pink Fluffy Clouds
instructions: Shake ingredients together over ice and serve in chilled cocktail glasses.

name: Pink Forest
instructions: Shake and strain into a champagne saucer.

ingredients.name: Marie Brizard® Creme de Fraise des Bois

name: Pink Heart
instructions: Pour the chambord and creme de cacao into a rocks or old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Fill with cream or milk.

name: Pink Iguana
instructions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a martini cocktail glass with a thin disk of lime floating in drink, and serve.

name: Pink Jacket
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Pink Jinx
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Pink Lady
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pink Lemonade
instructions: Shake and serve on the rocks.

name: Pink Lenin-ade
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice and shake. Pour into a tumbler and garnish with a lemon wedge and a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Pink Limon
instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled, sugar-rimmed cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon wheel.

name: Pink Mocha Martini
instructions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini glass. For more dramatic appearance, keep Chambord seperate and pour in slowly at end - it will settle to the bottom.

name: Pink n' Tart
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass, or stir well in an old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice.

name: Pink Paradise
instructions: Pour the tequila into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, and stir. Pour the bitters into a brandy snifter and swirl around in order to coat the glass. Discard any excess bitters from the glass, then strain the tequila into the glass, and serve.

name: Pink Penis
instructions: Add orange juice, cherry limeade, and alcohol into shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into champagne flute. Slowly pour in the grenadine so it settles on bottom. Drink like a shooter.

name: Pink Pitch
instructions: Mix in a blender on low speed and serve in a chilled glass. Garnish with a cherry.

name: Pink Pleasures
instructions: Put all ingredients in a blender and blend with 2 cups of ice. Serve in a martini glass with a sugared rim and a lemon twist.

name: Pink Polka
instructions: Shake all liquid ingredients with ice, pour into Martini glass. Impale cherry with tiny sword and serve.

name: Pink Pussycat
instructions:
Pour above listed ingredients into a 
Rocks glass filled with ice.

name: Pink Rain
instructions: Place 3 ice cubes in a cocktail glass. Add strawberry liqueur, vodka, gin and grenadine, then top up with the tonic water. Garnish with two strawberries in the drink.

name: Pink Squirrel
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pink Squirrel #2
instructions: Pour ingredients into an ice-filled mixing glass, and shake or stir. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Pink Star
instructions: Add all ingredients (except grenadine) to a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Add grenadine to achieve a light pink color. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pink Thing #1
instructions: Shake vigorously with lots of ice in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a chilled martini glass, and serve.

ingredients.name: Ocean Spray® Ruby Red grapefruit juice

name: Pink Thing #2
instructions: Stir together in a glass and serve.

name: Pink Top
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pink Tutu
instructions: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with cherry.

name: Pinko
instructions: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass filled with broken ice. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Pino Frio
instructions: Pour white rum, two heaped tablespoons of pineapple chunks, and sugar into an old-fashioned glass. Blend until smooth, add three-quarters of a glassful of crushed ice and blend again briefly.

name: Pinsk Peach
instructions: Blend with cracked ice until the pineapple is liquified. Serve in a chilled stemmed glass. For more color, add more blue Curacao.

name: Pinto Bomb
instructions: Drop a shot glass of really cheap vodka into a pint glass of really cheap beer and you have yourself the infamous Pinto Bomb!

name: Pipeline
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Piper
instructions: Pour tequila, lemon juice, dark creme de cacao and coffee (cooled to room temperature) into an irish coffee cup or irish coffee glass almost filled with crushed ice. Stir well, and serve.

name: Piper At Arms
instructions: Combine the scotch and vermouth in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: Piper At The Gates Of Dawn
instructions: Combine the scotch, kahlua, and maraschino liqueur in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Pour the cream over the back of a teaspoon so that it floats on top of the drink.

name: Pirate's Coffee
instructions: Mix together in glass and top off with ground cinnamon and/or whipped cream.

name: Pirate's Cordial
instructions: Pour ingredients into a shaker with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a cordial glass.

name: Pirate's Float
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a glass with ice. Add cola, to taste, and serve on the rocks.

name: Pisang Garuda
instructions: Add pisang ambon and rum to a margarita glass with ice cubes. Fill with bitter lemon. Garnish with an orange slice, and serve with two straws.

name: Pisang Pistace
instructions: Shake well with five or six ice cubes and serve in a cocktail glass with two ice cubes.

name: Pisco Sour
instructions: Add all ingredients to a mixer with ice. Shake well (until ice is melted), and serve in a cocktail glass.

name: Pisco-Rita
instructions: Add frozen limeade concentrate, pisco, and triple sec to a blender. Fill with ice, and blend on high speed (keep topping with water until full). When done, serve in a margarita glass rimmed with salt.

name: Piss in the Woods
instructions: Measure one shot each of tequila, and triple sec. Then you fill the glass with ice and then pour the lemonade and the shots into the glass.

name: Piss On Me
instructions: Shake everything with 3 cubes of ice. Pour into glass.

name: Piss on the Ground
instructions: Layer Cointreau on top of Kahlua and shoot!

name: Piss Water
instructions: Combine brandy, peach schnapps and Triple Sec over ice in a pint glass. Fill with Fresca. Stir.

name: Pissed McGillis
instructions: Mix ingredients together in glass.

name: Pistachio Cream
instructions: Blend ingredients briefly at low speed. Pour into a chilled champagne flute and serve.

name: Pistachio Mint Ice Cream
instructions: Blend until smooth and pour into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a mint leaf, and serve.

name: Pistachio Rumba
instructions: Blend briefly in a wine goblet half-filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a slice of lime and a cherry. Serve with short straws.

name: Pit Cocktail
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Pit Stop
instructions: Pour into an old-fashioned glass half-filled with broken ice, and serve.

name: Plank Walker
instructions: Pour ingredients into a rocks glass three-quarters filled with broken ice.

name: Planter's Cocktail
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Serve.

name: Platelets
instructions: Just mix together in a glass and enjoy!

name: Platina Blonde
instructions: Pour tequila into a cocktail glass, fill with cream, and stir.

name: Platinum Blonde
instructions: Shake and strain into a brandy snifter, and serve.

name: Platinum Grand Margarita
instructions:
Salt the rim of a margarita glass and pour in freshly squeezed lime juice. 

Add margarita mix, tequila, grand marnier, cointreau, triple sec, irish mist, and 5 ice cubes in a shaker. Shake vigorously until thoroughly mixed and cold. Pour into the margarita glass and garnish with a lime wheel, and a maraschino cherry if desired.

name: Player's Passion
instructions: Pour pre-chilled ingredients in order into a champagne saucer. Stir, and serve.

name: Playful Princess
description: "The drink is clear so it looks clean and classy on the outside and inside you're chasing the Good Humor truck.  I thought it up at Frankies in Pt. Pleasant Beach, NJ.  It's name and it's taste is very Jersey Girl."Pour ingredients over ice, shake and strain into glass. Garnish with a slice of orange.
instructions: Pour ingredients over ice, shake and strain into glass. Garnish with a slice of orange.

name: Playmate
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Plaza Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except pineapple stick) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the stick of pineapple and serve.

name: Plaza Martini
instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Pleasure Dome
instructions: Layer brandy, creme de cacao and benedictine in that order in a pousee cafe glass.

name: Pleasure Juice
instructions: Shake liquids with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cranberries; garnish with an onion slice on the edge of the glass.

name: Plenty O'Toole
instructions: Shake and strain into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice.

name: Plimsoll Cocktail
description: Popular at Plimsoll Club in New Orleans. Created by head bartender Tommy Borne. Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with cherry speared to orange slice on glass rim.
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with cherry speared to orange slice on glass rim.

name: PMS Special
instructions: Shake with ice and strain over ice in a cocktail glass.

name: Pocket Ball
instructions: Shake everything with ice; strain into a sour glass.

name: Pocket Rocket
description: This drink was invented by Chuck Nourse in Van Dyne, Wisconsin when the local bar ran out of orange juice to make Screwdrivers. The clever bartender substituted Orange Hooch (now defunct), getting Chuck very drunk to which he declared the drink "puts a rocket in your pocket!". The drink was then made famous in Eau Claire, WI on the UWEC campus, and is also a mainstay in the Eagle River, WI and Minneapolis, MN areas. In a pint sized glass filled with ice, pour the glass half full of vodka and then top with mix. Orange mixes best, with berry flavors also a favorable option. Skyy vodka is preferred, as it mixes well and is not overly expensive for the quantities used in this type of drink.
instructions: In a pint sized glass filled with ice, pour the glass half full of vodka and then top with mix. Orange mixes best, with berry flavors also a favorable option. Skyy vodka is preferred, as it mixes well and is not overly expensive for the quantities used in this type of drink.

name: Poinsetta
instructions: Stir ingredients together in a champagne glass, and serve.

name: Poker Cocktail
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Serve.

name: Polar Bear #3
instructions: Pour equal parts of vodka and lime juice into a glass with ice. Add the same, combined amount in 7-up or sprite. Mix and serve with a straw.

name: Polish Professor
instructions: Pour vodka and pineapple juice into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Add 7-up, stir, and serve.

name: Pollyanna
instructions: Muddle ingredients together in a mixing glass. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Polo Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Polonaise
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

name: Polynesian Cocktail
instructions: Rub the rim of a cocktail glass with lime and dip into powdered sugar. Shake vodka, cherry brandy, and juice of lime with ice, strain into the sugar-rimmed glass, and serve.

name: Pomapolitan
instructions: Take chilled cocktail glass and rim with sugar. Pour all ingredients into iced shaker. Squeeze lime slice into mixing glass and drop it in. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Pomegranate Martini
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Add a dash of rose water if available. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve. Our fan Murray W. on Facebook recommends trying the recipe with Grand Mariner [or Cointreau] instead of simple syrup.

name: Pomegranate Polecat
instructions: Shake and strain into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice.

name: Pompano
instructions: Shake with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pompanski
instructions: Shake with a glassful of broken ice and pour unstrained into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a slice of orange and serve with a short straw.

name: Pompeii
instructions: Shake and strain into a cocktail saucer. Sprinkle with almond flakes, and serve.

name: Pompey Royale
instructions: Dissolve sugar in juices, and add to a champagne saucer with champagne and syrup.

name: Pooh Bear
instructions: Pour ingredients over ice.

name: Pooky and Chooky
instructions: Shake with ice, and pour into a cocktail glass without ice.

name: Poolside Margarita
instructions: Frappe in a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Poop Deck Cocktail
instructions: Shake with ice in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Poop Deck Daddy
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass.

name: Poor Man's Margarita
instructions: Combine all wet ingredients. Squeeze them lime wedge, then drop in the glass. Add the pinch of salt

name: Poor Man's Martini
instructions: Pour the vodka into a small styrofome cup and fill the rest with coke!

name: Poor Man's Vodka Martini
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Poor Tim
instructions: Pour whiskey, vermouth and Chambord into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Pop Crotch
instructions: Stir the liqueur and the iced tea in an old-fashioned glass. Add the Pop Rocks and stir again. Increase quantities as need, try chilled or with different flavours of Pop Rocks.

name: Poppin' the Cherry
instructions: Mix all the ingredients and add a cherry to the bottom of the glass. Serve.

name: Poppy Cocktail
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Por Vida Kahiki
instructions: Shake very well,  Strain into coctail glass. Garnish with wedge of Pineapple

name: Pork Chop on Toast
instructions: Shake russian and cherry vodka and strain into a glass half-filled with broken ice. Add tonic water, garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: Port and Brandy
instructions: Pour the port and brandy into a brandy snifter. Stir well, and serve.

name: Port And Starboard
instructions: Pour carefully into a pousse cafe glass, so that the creme de menthe floats on top of the grenadine. Serve without mixing.

name: Port Aransas
instructions: You might say "Isn't this just a Malibu & Coke?"  But the key ingredient is that this is a Malibu & Coke...in Texas! If you are in Texas, you must order this drink as a Port Aransas (named after the great Texas beach).

name: Port Side
instructions: Stir and strain into a brandy snifter.

name: Port Wine Cocktail
instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Port Wine Flip
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

name: Porterhouse Blue
instructions: Shake and strain into an ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish with a slice of lemon and a cherry.

name: Porto Flip
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle with nutmeg, and serve.

name: Portuguese Daisy
instructions: Pour the port, brandy, lemon juice, sugar and grenadine into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well and pour into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a lemon wedge, and serve.

name: Pot O' Gold
instructions: Blend over ice. Sip or chug.

name: Potpourri
instructions: Shake everything with ice; strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Pousse Cafe
instructions: Layer in a cordial glass.

name: Pousse Cafe #2
instructions: Layer in a pousse cafe glass.

name: Pousse Cafe a la Francaise
instructions: Pour the chartreuse into a pousse-cafe glass. Carefully float the maraschino liqueur on top by pouring slowly over the back of a teaspoon. Do the same with the cherry brandy, and then again with the kummel. Serve.

name: Pousse Cafe Standish
instructions: Pour the grenadine into a pousse-cafe glass. Carefully float the white creme de menthe on top by pouring slowly over the back of a teaspoon. Do the same with the galliano, and then again with the kummel, and then lastly with the brandy.

name: Pousse L'Amour
instructions: Layer maraschino liqueur, unborken egg yolk, benedictine and cognac, in that order.

name: Pousse Mozart
instructions: Pour the white mozart into a cordial glass. Slowly and carefully pour original mozart on top using the back of the spoon. Serve.

name: Pousse Rapier
instructions: In a sugar rimmed champagne glass, pour the creme d'Armagnac, then fill with champagne. Garnish with a slice of orange.

name: Power of Will
instructions: Melt a small amount of bee pollen and butter and pour into a cocktail glass. Squeeze the strawberry in the glass and add equal parts of rum and vodka to fill.

name: Prado
instructions: Shake everything with ice; strain into a sour glass. Garnish with a lime slice.

name: Prairie Chicken

name: Preakness Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

name: Presidente

name: Presidente Seco

name: Presticles Spectacles Wallet and Watch

name: Presto Cocktail
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Pretty In Pink
instructions: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass.

ingredients.name: Captain Morgan® Parrot Bay pineapple rum

name: Pretty Martini
instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange twist, and serve.

name: Pretty Thing
instructions: Pour vodka, amaretto, coconut cream and heavy cream into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Prince Edward Martini
instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: Prince Elizabeth Martini
instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve.

name: Prince Igor's Nightcap
instructions: Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender and serve in a chilled, stemmed glass. Sprinkle with grated nutmeg.

name: Prince Rupert
instructions: Pour the whiskey and anisette into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Prince's Smile
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Prince's Smile
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Princess Alexandra
instructions: Shake or blend with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top, and serve.

name: Princess Cocktail
instructions: Sugar rim of glass. Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass.

name: Princess Martini
instructions: Pour gin into glass and add equal parts orange juice and pineapple juice. Top up glass with Fresca.

name: Princess Pousse Cafe
instructions: Pour brandy into a pousse cafe glass. Pour cream carefully onto brandy, so that it does not mix.

name: Princeton Cocktail
instructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Prohibition Cocktail
instructions: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Squeeze in a twist of lemon and discard.

name: Psychic Venom
instructions: Mix together and shake, strain into an old fashioned bar glass with a slice of lime.

name: Psycho
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange slice, pineapple chunk and maraschino cherry.

name: Psychofraculator
description: Named for the famous device used by Casanova Frankenstein to kill Captain Amazing in the classic film "Mystery Men". Designed by two road weary travelers named Mike and David, it was first mixed by the amazing crew at the Doubletree Inn (Finn And Porter's) in Missoula MT in the summer of 2004. They used to say it couldn't be built. The equations were so complex that the scientists that worked on it ended up in the insane asylum. Enjoy... tell them David and Mike sent you.Equal parts tequila and gin, add cranberry juice. Finish with a splash of lemonade, and a splash of Grand Marnier... then top with a maraschino cherry. Best (well, better anyway) with top-shelf pours.
instructions: Equal parts tequila and gin, add cranberry juice. Finish with a splash of lemonade, and a splash of Grand Marnier... then top with a maraschino cherry. Best (well, better anyway) with top-shelf pours.

name: Pucker
instructions: Pour whiskey generously over ice in a whiskey sour glass. Add unsweetened grapefruit juice, 7-up (optional), and serve.

name: Real Sazerac
description:
This is the true New Orleans original (had to put it straight as it's where I'm from and one of my favorite drinks to mix).
Antoine Peychaud (a pharmicist) had invented his own bitters for the cure of ailments and one day someone decided to make it a bit less medicinal.
It's critical for the true New Orleans Original to have the Peychauds, Sazerac, and Herbsaint all of which were born in and are made near New Orleans.
Also be sure to visit New Orleans, it's an amazing place to go at least once in your lifetime, and an incredible place to live.Take two old-fashioned glasses.  Chill one with crushed ice.  In the other: muddle the sugar cube, water, and bitters.  Add the bourbon (or brandy if you want another 1850's version) and stir.  

Dump the ice from the first glass and pour enough of the Herbsaint to coat the inside of the glass (a wash).  Swirl it around, then dump the rest.  Add new ice and the contents of the second glass.  Finally twist a lemon peel over it, but don't add it to the drink.
instructions:
Take two old-fashioned glasses.  Chill one with crushed ice.  In the other: muddle the sugar cube, water, and bitters.  Add the bourbon (or brandy if you want another 1850's version) and stir.  

Dump the ice from the first glass and pour enough of the Herbsaint to coat the inside of the glass (a wash).  Swirl it around, then dump the rest.  Add new ice and the contents of the second glass.  Finally twist a lemon peel over it, but don't add it to the drink.

name: Red Apple Martini
instructions:
Combine all ingredients in a shaker with cracked ice, cover and shake. Served in a chilled martini cocktail glass, rimmed with sugar and garnished with a red apple slice. 

To rim the glass with sugar: pour a small amount of grenadine onto a small plate. Set the rim of the chilled martini glass into the grenadine and carefully rotate the glass for even coverage. Then, to rim with the sugar: using sugar on a seperate plate after the glass has been rimmed with the grenadine, gently sit the rim of the glass into the sugar and remove. Immediatly after, strain the chilled martini mixture into the sugar rimmed glass and garnish with a thinly sliced, red apple slice.

name: Roaring 40's
description: Roaring 40's requires a smooth, premium vodka like 42 Below or a good Polish vodka for best results.Pour Licor 43 over ice in a cocktail shaker. Stir, add 42 Below vodka, and shake firmly until cold settles in. Pour double strained through a tea strainer into a martini cocktail glass (should be a smokey colour, the colour of white horses on a stormy sea). Garnish with a floated twist of dried vanilla bean, and serve.
instructions: Pour Licor 43 over ice in a cocktail shaker. Stir, add 42 Below vodka, and shake firmly until cold settles in. Pour double strained through a tea strainer into a martini cocktail glass (should be a smokey colour, the colour of white horses on a stormy sea). Garnish with a floated twist of dried vanilla bean, and serve.

instructions:
Stir in an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

Give to a captive double agent to get information out of them. (Reference in the 1998 movie "Ronin".)

name: Rose Martini
description:
Created by Rose Vargas and Thomas Palmgren in the summer of 2004. Offered and received with popularity on cruises and at house parties alike.Mix equal parts (1 jigger or 1 1/2 oz) of "Grey Goose" (the best), Dekuyper Watermelon Pucker and Dekuyper Sour Apple Pucker along with a teaspoon of sweetned lime juice cordial. Combine ingredents in a shaker with ice and shake well. Strain into a stemmed cocktail glass and garnish with a cherry.

Get ready to taste the most refreshing, soothing "Rose" colored drink you ever had! But be carefull. One taste great, the second feels real good, by the third you're mellow.

We have converted 30 year old Scotch drinkers, Remy drinkers and life long Wine drinkers. So get ready to cross over. Once you hold this smart looking drink in your hands people will ask," What's that ??" " That looks good."  You'll say," it's a Rose Martini."

name: Sazerac
instructions: Pour ricard into a glass and swirl around to coat the glass; discard any excess. Place the sugar, peychaud bitters, and water into the glass and muddle with the back of a teaspoon. Almost fill the glass with ice cubes. Pour the bourbon over the ice cubes, add a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Sazerac #2
instructions: In a spare glass, mix the bourbon, the sugar syrup, and the two kinds of bitters. Make a twist of lemon peel by peeling it from a lemon with a sharp vegetable peeler. Rub firmly around the rim of a well-iced old-fashioned glass. Put the Pernod in the glass and swirl it around to coat the bottom. Add the contents of the other glass along with one ice cube. Serve.

name: Sazerac Cocktail
instructions: Chill an old-fashioned glass by filling with crushed ice. In another glass mix the sugar with the bitters dissolving the sugar. Add some ice, stirring to chill. In the old-fashioned glass remove the ice and pour in the absinthe coating the entire glass. Remove the excess absinthe. Add the rye whiskey and bitters/sugar mixture. Add the lemon twist.

name: Screaming Orgasm
instructions:
Pour first vodka, then Bailey's, then Kahlua into a cocktail glass over crushed ice. Stir.

Caution: use only high quality vodka. Cheap vodka can cause the Bailey's to curdle. Test your brand of vodka by mixing 1 Tsp each of vodka and Bailey's first

name: Screaming Orgasm (San Francisco Style)
instructions: Combine and stir ingredients, add ice, and serve.

name: Screaming Slippery Bald Beaver

name: Screaming Viking
instructions: Stir liquids with ice then strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with celery and cucumber. Serve immediately.

name: Screaming White Orgasm
instructions:
Fill up the shaker with ice and put the ingredients in it. 

Shake it until it gets frosty on the outside. Before you start shaking, place ice cubes in the glass and fill it up with water so the glass is cold when you have shaken the drink. Take the ice cubes and water out of the glass, and fill the glass again with ice cubes and pour the drink in the glass.

name: Screw The City
instructions: Pour vodka and Cointreau over ice in a cocktail shaker. Add cranberry juice and a splash of orange juice. Shake vigorously and pour into a chilled martini cocktail glass. Take an orange peel (about 1 in.) squeeze it over a match on top of the cocktail. Place orange peel in cocktail, and serve.

name: Screwed Driver

name: Scurvy

name: Seduction on the Rocks

name: Senators Sweet Stuff
description: "Red (cranberry), gold (banana), and black (coffee) are the colours of the Ottawa Senators. I invented this drink while living in Toronto, just so I could bug the hell out of the Leafs fans. The drink is fairly sweet, which is why I decided to add the club soda. It cuts the sweetness a bit." Inventor & contributor: Tori E.Fill glass with ice. Pour in liqueurs. Fill with equal parts club soda and cranberry juice.
instructions: Fill glass with ice. Pour in liqueurs. Fill with equal parts club soda and cranberry juice.

name: Senegali Sunshine
instructions:
Use a thick-skinned california orange, peeling the rind very close to the edge. Avoid the white pulp, and chop the rind finely.

Combine the other ingredients in a blender with the rind, and blend until smooth and thick. Pour into 4oz glasses and garnish with orange slices and fresh strawberries.

name: Sensation Cocktail

name: Sensei on the Rocks

name: Separator
instructions:
Fill rocks glass with ice, add brandy, Kahlua, and milk. Shake well, return to glass.

Brandy can be substituted for Cognac.

name: September Morn
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Sex in the Shower

instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender with crushed ice and blend until the drink has reached the desired consistency. Pour unstrained into a cocktail glass and garnish with whipped cream and a cherry.

name: Sex on the Beach #11
instructions: Pour into a glass, and serve unstirred.

name: Sex on the Beach #2
instructions: Mix all ingredients together over ice. Chill and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Sex on the Beach #4
instructions: This can be on the rocks or up... but best on the rocks! Start with the Midori since it is heaviest, then the Chambord and the Absolut. Fill the glass 2/3 full with Cranberry juice, and then a splash of grapefruit for color. It should be an orangish-red color. Garnish with several cherries.

name: Sex On The Beach #5
instructions: Pour vodka over crushed ice in a champagne saucer. Add cranberry juice, midori, chambord, and top off with pineapple juice. Stir gently and serve.

name: Sex on the Beach #9
instructions: Use a shaker: first put in the ice, then add the orange juice ( you should always add the fruit juices before the alcohol! ). Put both the Passoa and the Malibu in and give it a good shake. Poor in a glass and add a cube of ice. The poor a bit of cream on top of the ice cubes ( preferably using a teaspoon or so to keep the cream from mixing with the other stuff ). Put a cherry on top and voila, there's your Sex on the Beach.

name: Sex under the Boardwalk
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass.

name: Sexy Lemonade
instructions: Pour into a large rocks glass filled with ice. Stir well, garnish with two slices of lemon, and serve.

name: Sexy Martini
instructions: Pour 2 shots of vodka, preferrably Grey Goose or Belvedere,  then add 1 shot of chambord, then add 1 shot of hypnotiq and shake, don't stir.  Once shaken pour into a cocktail glass and pour a splash of champagne, preferrably brut.

name: Shagger
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Shaker Cocktail
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Shakin' Blue Monday
instructions: Add the whisky, blueberry brandy, brandy, lemon juice and sugar to a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Garnish with a slice of orange and a maraschino cherry.

name: Shalom
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.

name: Shamrock
instructions: Stir all ingredients (except olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.

name: Shamrock #2
instructions: Pour ingredients in a cocktail glass.

name: Shanghai
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Shanghai Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Shannon on the Beach
instructions: Mix the two alcohols and fill with orange and cranberry juice.

name: Shark Bite
instructions: Fill a shaker with ice. Add the spiced rum, light rum, sour, and blue curacco. Shake the ingredients well. Strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with three drops of grenadine.

name: Shark's Mai Tai
instructions: Mix all ingedients in a blender except for the 151 rum. Pour into a cocktail glass with ice to about 1 inch below the rim. Add the shot of 151 but do not mix. Let settle for about 1 minute before serving.

name: Shark's Nipple
instructions: Pour rum in over the ice, fill approximately to halfway with Mt. Dew, fill with cranberry juice, then mix again.

name: Sharples
instructions: Pour both ingredients into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with crushed ice. Stir, and serve.

name: She's Paying
instructions: Shake and strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with broken ice. Add a speared cherry, and serve.

name: Sherburger
description: Invented at Cory's in Northern California, this drink is noted for its proximity in flavor to sherbert. Popular among those who don't like to taste their liquor.Fill chilled old fashioned glass halfway with ice. Pour Lemon Lime soda (Sprite and Squirt make slightly variant flavors), then Raspberry Vodka (Bacardi or other) then Orange Juice, and stir. Top with a splash or two of coconut rum (Malibu or other), between 1/4 and 1/2 oz. Garnish with a wedge of orange and lime.
instructions: Fill chilled old fashioned glass halfway with ice. Pour Lemon Lime soda (Sprite and Squirt make slightly variant flavors), then Raspberry Vodka (Bacardi or other) then Orange Juice, and stir. Top with a splash or two of coconut rum (Malibu or other), between 1/4 and 1/2 oz. Garnish with a wedge of orange and lime.

name: Sherman Tank
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Sherry Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel, and serve.

name: Sherry Flip
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

name: SherryBear's Lemonade
instructions: Lemonade made from frozen concentrate works best. Don't use Kool-Aid type lemonade. For a twist, also try Pink Lemonade.

name: Shetty Classic
instructions: Pour Ricard, Bacardi rum and Absolut vodka into a bowl filled with sugar. Set on fire (use extreme caution) and let the sugar dissolve. Allow the drink to cool, and serve in a cocktail glass.

name: Shimmers
instructions: Pour the st. hallvard over ice (on the rocks) in an old-fashioned glass, then add aquavit. Add a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Shindig
instructions: Shake with a glassful of broken ice and pour unstrained into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a slice of orange and a cherry, and serve.

name: Shiny Nail
instructions: Stir with ice. Pour into glass.

name: Shirley Effen
description: Invented by a really big fan of Effen 's Black Cherry Vodka, flavored with the essence of black cherry and vanilla, no added sugars or sweeteners. Tastes similar to a "Shirley Temple" kiddie cocktail, but is more organic and (obviously) stronger.Pour Grenadine into bottom of short cocktail glass. Fill to top with ice. Pour vodka and soda at same time gently over ice. Garnish with a Maraschino or better, a black cherry.
instructions: Pour Grenadine into bottom of short cocktail glass. Fill to top with ice. Pour vodka and soda at same time gently over ice. Garnish with a Maraschino or better, a black cherry.

name: Shotgun Lou
instructions: Mix brandy, milk and brown sugar on ice. Top with ginger ale, and serve.

name: Shriner Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

name: Si Kami Ki
instructions: Mix vodka and cinnamon schnapps in cocktail glass, add carbonated water, serve with ice.

name: Siberian Slider
instructions: Mix equal parts into a tumber filled with cracked ice. Stir liberally and sip slowly.

name: Sid Vicious
instructions: Pour whiskey, gin, vermouth over ice and stir. Strain into an old-fashioned glass, add bitters and worcestershire sauce. Garnish with poppy seeds.

name: Siddharta
description: Named after the Slovenian rock group Siddharta. When mixed correctly, it shows the colours of the slovenian flag.Serve in a long drink glass, decorate with a slice of pineapple, a cherry, some lime and mint. Add ice.
instructions: Serve in a long drink glass, decorate with a slice of pineapple, a cherry, some lime and mint. Add ice.

name: Side Kick
instructions: Shake all ingredients with lot's of ice.

name: Sidecar
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel.

name: Sienna
instructions: Pour ingredients over ice cubes in a tall wine glass, and serve.

name: Silent Broadsider
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Silent Monk
instructions: Pour the benedictine, Cointreau and light cream into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Silk Stocking
instructions: Pour tequila, dark creme de cacao, heavy cream and Chambord into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Silk Stockings
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cinnamon) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle cinnamon on top and serve.

name: Silver Bronx
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

name: Silver Bullet #2
instructions: Pour scotch into an iced glass and coat sides. Empty scotch out pour in vodka.

name: Silver Cloud
instructions: Mix amaretto, kahlua, and milk together. Fill with ice cubes and top with whipped cream.

name: Silver Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

name: Silver Jubilee
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Silver King Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Silver Sunset
instructions: Combine the vodka, apricot brandy, Campari, both juices and the egg white in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry and a slice of orange, and serve.

name: Silverado
instructions: Pour ingredients over ice into an old-fashioned glass. Stir and serve.

name: Simple But Sweet
instructions: Pour vodka in rocks glass. Half fill with apricot nectar.

name: Simple Charm
instructions: Stir liquors and strain in to coctail-glass. Float cream gently on top. Garnish with cinnamon powder.

name: Simply Exquisite
instructions: Pour ingredients into a stainless shaker over ice, shake until completely cold then strain into a chilled stemmed glass.

name: Sir Knight
instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon.

name: Sir Walter Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Sitarski
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.

name: Six Chicks
description: A quite refreshing cocktail for those hot, humid days. Six Chicks was invented in Richmond, Indiana at Earlham College (a dry campus) by Andrew Wardenaar.Ensure all ingredients have been chilled thoroughly. Pour the brandy and lemon juice into a double shot glass and stir together. Pour the Merlot and tonic water into a cocktail glass, and stir these together. Add the contents from the shot glass to the Merlot and tonic, and serve.
