instructions: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

name: Twains Orgasm
instructions: Layer in order in a pousse-cafe glass.

name: Tweetie Bird
instructions: Pour all ingredients in mixer with ice and shake. Strain into cocktail glass.

name: Twentieth Century
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve.

name: Twenty Thousand Leagues
instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Twin Hills
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon slice) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lemon and serve.

name: Twin Peaks
instructions: Pour whiskey, Dubonnet and Cointreau into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Two Turtles
instructions: Pour whisky, Cointreau and B & B benedictine into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry, and serve.

name: UFO
instructions: Pour genever gin into a glass, and fill with bitter lemon. Add ice cubes, and serve.

name: Ugly Buddy
description: "This was my own recipe when I tended bar some 40 years ago in Detroit. The girls liked it because they always wanted to kick ass after they had a couple of these."Fill cocktail shaker with orange juice, brandy and vodka and crushed ice.  Now shake it, pour into a cocktail glass,  garnish with orange slice twist and cherry. Now drink it.
instructions: Fill cocktail shaker with orange juice, brandy and vodka and crushed ice.  Now shake it, pour into a cocktail glass,  garnish with orange slice twist and cherry. Now drink it.

name: Ulanda Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Ultimate Bloody Mary
description: A very spicy drink... Good to get the evening kicked off and also useful as a relief for the morning after (If you can take the heat!)  Developed by a former southern bartender who likes to chase them with a cold beer!Pour vodka, V-8, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, salt, black pepper, and squeeze lemon wedge into glass; shake.  Serve over rocks.  Garnish with 4 - 5 olives on a toothpick, 1 banana pepper, 1 pod pickled okra, 1 celery stalk, and sprinkle with approx. 1/8 tsp Tony's.
instructions: Pour vodka, V-8, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, salt, black pepper, and squeeze lemon wedge into glass; shake.  Serve over rocks.  Garnish with 4 - 5 olives on a toothpick, 1 banana pepper, 1 pod pickled okra, 1 celery stalk, and sprinkle with approx. 1/8 tsp Tony's.

name: Ultimate Blue Frozen Margarita
instructions: Pour ingredient into a blender, over the ice, in order listed. Blend on "high" for a few seconds until drink has a consistancy a bit icier than a slurpee. Take lime wedge and run it over the edges of the margarita glass, then, upturned, place the wetted rims into course salt. Pour the now ready margarita into the now salted glasses and serve.

name: Ultimate Chocolate Martini
description: "I learned how to make this martini working as a bartender in an upscale restaurant.  I'd often have to remind the ladies that this drink is all alcohol, as they would drink it so fast because it is fabulous!"Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake vigorously.  Strain into a martini glass and serve.  To enhance appearance, drizzle chocolate syrup into glass before pouring martini.  Note: do not substitute creme de cocoa or any other chocolate flavored liquor for the Godiva liquors, as they are the key to the drink and well-worth the added expense.  After this chocolate martini, cheap imitations made with creme de cocoa are unacceptable.
instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake vigorously.  Strain into a martini glass and serve.  To enhance appearance, drizzle chocolate syrup into glass before pouring martini.  Note: do not substitute creme de cocoa or any other chocolate flavored liquor for the Godiva liquors, as they are the key to the drink and well-worth the added expense.  After this chocolate martini, cheap imitations made with creme de cocoa are unacceptable.

name: Ultimate Margarita
instructions: Pour tequila, cointreau, and sweet & sour over crushed ice. Add lime juice. Can be made frozen by putting in a blender with 3 cups ice.

name: Ultimate Margarita #2
instructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker and shake. Serve in salted (optional) margarita glasses.

name: Ultimate Mudslide
instructions: Place all ingredients, except grated chocolate, in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour into glass and sprinkle with grated chocolate.

name: Unicorn
instructions: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake & strain into martini glass or champagne cup. Garnish with red straws & tacky plastic animals (preferably horses or mermaids) Add parasols & slice of orange if available.

name: Union Jack Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Upside-Down Martini
instructions: Stir together in a mixing glass filled with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Upsidedown Pineapple Cake
description: Courtesy of Ryan McKenzie, "this is my most famous drink as a bartending instructor, I came up with it and I've taught every one of my students at www.PBSA.com Pittsburgh branch."Pour 1 oz stoli vanilla vodka in old fashioned glass. Fill with pineapple juice, then spoon float grenadine to the bottom of the drink till it settles almost like a tequila sunrise.
instructions: Pour 1 oz stoli vanilla vodka in old fashioned glass. Fill with pineapple juice, then spoon float grenadine to the bottom of the drink till it settles almost like a tequila sunrise.

name: Urban Jungle
instructions: Blend briefly with a tablespoon of crushed ice in a champagne saucer, and serve.

name: Urban Violence
instructions:
Use strawberry, orange or banana tropicana.

Put some ice in your favorite glass. Add liquor. Fill up remainder with the tropicana, stir, and serve.

name: Urbinos
instructions: Shake, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: V & D Bedbanger
description: "Created on board a cruise ship somewhere in the Baltic Sea, by Dayro Villalba, Colombian Bartender who at that time was in love with a english dancer who worked on board, named Vanessa so he used their first initials to name the drink, the second part of the name was given by their neighbours!!"Mix vodka and passion fruit juice in a old fashioned glass, Drambuie on top. Decorate with a wild Orchid or Rose.
instructions: Mix vodka and passion fruit juice in a old fashioned glass, Drambuie on top. Decorate with a wild Orchid or Rose.

name: Vaitkus
instructions: Shake ingredients, pour into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Valencia Cocktail
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Vampire's Kiss
instructions: Shake with ice, strain over ice in an old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Vampiro #2
description: For those that love tequila, this is a great alternative to a Bloody Mary. Milagro is a great medium to high grade tequila (either their Blanco, Reposado or Anejo); you can substitute either Reposado or Anejo to add a slightly different flavor to this recipe.Combine the first 6 ingredients and shake; stir in club soda and serve in a glass with a salted rim.
instructions: Combine the first 6 ingredients and shake; stir in club soda and serve in a glass with a salted rim.

name: Van Nuys (aka Dirty Margarita)
description: Invented by H.B. Stone, inspired by the city of Van Nuys, CA... It's a tasty drink; citrus at first, then the sweetness of the Kahlua builds after you swallow.Shake and strain into a thoroughly chilled margarita glass. Optionally, build over ice in an old fashioned glass.
instructions: Shake and strain into a thoroughly chilled margarita glass. Optionally, build over ice in an old fashioned glass.

name: Van Vleet
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

name: Vanderbilt
instructions: Pour into an old-fashioned glass filled with broken ice. Add a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Vegas Lemon Drop Martini
instructions: Slice the 1/4 lemon into two seperate wedges. Place in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Pour the Absolut Citron into the shaker, and add one teaspoon of sugar. Shake vigorously. Strain into a sugar-rimmed cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Velvet Crush
instructions: Pour gin into a glass with ice. Add flavored kool aid (to taste), and serve.

name: Velvet Hammer
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Velvet Kilt
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice until chilled, and strain into a frosted cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry or small butterscotch candy.

name: Velvet Moose
instructions: Pour everything into the blender and blend to desired consistency. Scale everything up by the number of cups your blender holds to do a full batch.  If you plan to make "doubles" I recommend increasing the amount of Daiquiri mix by the same factor to maintain the balance of flavour.

name: Vendome
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Venezia
instructions: Mix, and pour into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange zest, and serve.

name: Venom
instructions: Pour gin into a malt shaker or similar. Stir in the cocoa and sugar, mix together and shake. Pour into a champagne flute glass, and serve.

name: Venus on the Rocks
instructions: Pour into an old-fashioned glass with five ice cubes. Garnish with a twist of lime, and serve.

name: Venus Rum
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except soda water) and strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with broken ice. Add soda, add straws, garnish with a slice of starfruit, and serve.

name: Verboten
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with a cherry, and serve.

name: Verdi
instructions: Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of peach and a mint sprig, and serve.

name: Vermouth Cassis #2
instructions: Pour vermouth and creme de cassis into an old-fashioned glass. Add three or four ice cubes, fill with soda, and serve.

name: Vermouth Cocktail
instructions: Stir well over ice cubes in a mixing glass. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Vernal Equinox
instructions: Pour ingredients into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Stir, and serve.

name: Vernon's Grog
description:
Grog has varied in strength throughout history, but vice-admiral Eward Vernon, the inventor of grog and a supporter of sailor's rights, first made grog with these measurements. At first, grog consisted of just rum and water, but it didn't take long for lemon juice and sugar to be added for flavor. It wasn't until 1851, roughly one hundred years after its invention, that other condiments were officially added.
A sailor's daily ration of grog consisted of the equivalent of 8 double shots of whiskey.Pour the rum into the container of your choice. A mug is suggested if a hot beverage is desired, but a glass works for a cool drink. Real Jamaican rum has the strong flavor that's desired for grog. Add sugar. Brown sugar can work as a substitute; white sugar is too flavorless to work well. Add a good tablespoon of lemon juice. Add cool or boiling water, depending on choice. Stir until the sugar is dissolved.

For extra flavor, cinnamon, in the form of a stick or powder, can be added. One stick or a pinch of powdered cinnamon is sufficient.
instructions:
Pour the rum into the container of your choice. A mug is suggested if a hot beverage is desired, but a glass works for a cool drink. Real Jamaican rum has the strong flavor that's desired for grog. Add sugar. Brown sugar can work as a substitute; white sugar is too flavorless to work well. Add a good tablespoon of lemon juice. Add cool or boiling water, depending on choice. Stir until the sugar is dissolved.

For extra flavor, cinnamon, in the form of a stick or powder, can be added. One stick or a pinch of powdered cinnamon is sufficient.

name: Vesuvio
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

name: Veteran
instructions: Pour rum and cherry brandy into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and serve.

name: Vibrator #2
instructions: Layer in order in a pousse-cafe glass.

name: Vicious Kiss
instructions: Pour into a cordial glass, stir gently, and serve.

name: Vicious Sid
instructions: Combine all of the ingredients in a shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, and strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.

name: Victor
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Vik n' Rum
instructions: Pour rum over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Add neatea lemon-flavored iced tea, stir well, and serve

name: Viking Warmer
instructions: Pour into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice. Garnish with a speared cherry, and serve.

name: Viscous Robert
instructions: Pour bitters over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass, and swirl in a dash of southern comfort. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel, an umbrella, and serve.

name: Visitor's Treat
instructions: Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Vista Way Margarita
description:
Courtesy of Raul Blanhir of El Callejon Restaurant, Vista, CA.Drambuie splash first, burn the liquor with fresh lime. Add ice, then add Tres generaciones tequila, Gaetano triple sec and stir.

Serve in a margarita 10 oz. glass with salt on the rim and serve.
instructions:
Drambuie splash first, burn the liquor with fresh lime. Add ice, then add Tres generaciones tequila, Gaetano triple sec and stir.

Serve in a margarita 10 oz. glass with salt on the rim and serve.

name: Viva Villa
instructions: Rub the rim of an old-fashioned glass with lemon juice and dip into salt. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass over ice cubes, and serve.

name: Viva Villa #2
instructions: Rub the rim of a cocktail glass with a lime wedge, and dip into sugar in a saucer or flat bowl; discard lime. Pour the tequila and juices into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Vixen
instructions: Pour grenadine and frangelico into an ice-filled cocktail shaker, and shake until frothy. Strain into a chilled martini glass, and slowly add the kahlua. Garnish with a cherry or hershey's kiss, and serve.

name: Vodka Amaretto Sour
instructions: Shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Vodka Cranberry
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a 6 oz old-fashioned glass half-filled with ice.  Vary the amount of vodka to your taste.  Add 2 straws and enjoy!

name: Vodka Daisy
instructions: Combine vodka, lemon juice, sugar and grenadine in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well and pour into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry and an orange slice, and serve.

name: Vodka Dry
instructions: Pour the sherry into a brandy snifter. Swirl it around in order to coat the glass, then pour out the excess. Stir the vodka in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, and strain into the snifter. Garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Vodka Gimlet
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Vodka Grasshopper
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Vodka Martini
instructions: Shake vodka and vermouth together with several ice cubes in a shaker. Strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with an olive and serve.

name: Vodka Sling
instructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in water and lemon juice. Add vodka, pour into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and stir. Garnish with a twist of orange peel and serve.

name: Vodka Sour
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Garnish with a stemmed cherry, and serve.

name: Vodka Stinger
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Vodkatini
instructions: Stir the vodka with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with a pitted cocktail olive, and serve in front with an open bottle of vermouth situated in front of a fan across the room.

name: Volga Boatman
instructions: Combine the orange juice, vodka and kirsch in a mixing glass add ice cubes. Shake vigorously and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Voodoo
instructions: Pour ingredients over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Stir, and serve.

name: Voodoo Doll
instructions: Add vodka and chambord to a shaker. Add orange juice and cranberry juice until desired taste. Shake and serve with ice in a cocktail glass.

name: Voodoo Lady
instructions: Pour triple sec, cognac, and lemon juice over ice. Shake, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Vruica Rakia
instructions: Heat in a small saucepan, dissolving sugar. Serve in a heat-proof cup when hot.

name: Waborita
instructions: In a shaker over ice combine the ingredients, pour into a salt rimmed martini glass and garnish with a slice of lime.

name: Wahoo
instructions: Pour 151 proof rum and amaretto over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Top off with pineapple juice (to taste), and serve.

name: Waikiki Beachcomber
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Waking to the Call of the Mockingbird
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Wallick Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: War Cloud
instructions: Shake, strain into a cordial or liqueur glass, and serve.

name: Warm Woolly Sheep
instructions: Mix scotch and drambuie, then top with warm milk.

name: Warped Thursday
instructions: Empty half a can of cherry coke, pour the vodka into the can, then pour in the kool-aid. Alternatively, use a 12oz glass. Stir. A kabob stick works well in the can.

name: Warrior Cocktail
instructions: Pour the vermouth, brandy, Pernod and Cointreau into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Warsaw Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Washington Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Washoe Peel
instructions: Pour all ingredients intoa cocktail shaker. Shake and strain over ice cubes in a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Waste of Time Cocktail
instructions: Shake, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Water Your Melon
instructions: Pour the mountain dew into any kind of ordinary glass. Then, add the watermelon schnapps and stir.

name: Watermelon Margarita
instructions: Cut up a watermelon, removing seeds. Liquify in a blender until you have about 16 oz. Add remaining ingredients, top with ice and blend until smooth. Taste and add sugar if watermelon is not sweet enough. Serve in a margarita glass with a sugar-coated rim.

name: Watermelon Martini
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint, and serve.

name: Watermelon Shooter #3
instructions: Pour all ingredients in any order into a sifting glass filled with ice. Shake for 5 seconds and pour the chilled contents into your cocktail glass.

name: Watermelon Shooter #4
instructions: Add ingredients in a shaker tin with ice, stir and strain into a rocks glass.

name: Watermelon Shooter #5
instructions: Pour ingredients into a mixing glass 1/4 of the way full with ice. Mix all four ingredients then strain into a rocks glass.

name: Waverunner
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except champagne) with ice. Strain into a sugar rimmed cocktail glass. Top with champagne. Squeeze and drop another wedge of lemon into the drink. (the other two should still be in the tin).

name: Weakness
instructions: Pour all four shots into a low ball glass, chill if you care.

name: Webster Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Wedding Bell Cocktail
instructions: Pour the Dubonnet, gin, cherry brandy, orange juice and orange bitters into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Wedding Belle Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Wedding Bells Cocktail
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Weekend On The Beach
instructions: Mix the crown royal, apple and peach schnapps, and sweet and sour mix with ice cubes in a shaker and shake until well blended. Strain into a shot glass. Makes one serving.

name: Weep-No-More Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Wembly Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Westerman Sings the Blues
instructions: Pour the vermouth, gin, and Pernod into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of orange, and serve.

name: Western Rose
instructions: Shake, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Western Rose
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Wet Dream
instructions: Mix all ingredients except chambord. Chill and strain mixture into a martini glass. Float chambord to the bottom of the glass.

name: Wet Pussy
instructions: Pour the chambord, irish cream, and milk or cream into a shaker with ice. Shake, strain and pour into a champagne saucer.

name: What The Hell
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass and serve.

name: Whip Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Whiskey All In
instructions: Pour the whiskey, sugar, lemon juice and hot water into an Irish coffee cup or glass. Stir well, garnish with a lemon twist and a whole clove, and serve.

name: Whiskey Cobbler
instructions: Muddle a skinless pineapple wedge, one slice of orange and one wedge of lemon with orange curacao and water in the bottom of a bar glass. Add whiskey and ice, and shake well. Strain into a double old-fashioned glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with remaining fruit, and serve.

name: Whiskey Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

name: Whiskey Crusta
instructions: Rub the rim of a wine goblet with a lemon wedge and dip into sugar to coat; discard lemon. Peel a spiral of orange peel from an orange and drape one end over the rim of the glass. Fill the glass with crushed ice. Combine the whiskey, Cointreau, maraschino and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into the wine goblet, and serve.

name: Whiskey Flip
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

name: Whiskey Hot Toddy
instructions: Heat in a heat-resistant glass, and fill with hot water. Add a lemon slice speared with a clove, and serve.

name: Whiskey Manhattan
instructions: Pour into an old-fashioned glass and serve.

name: Whiskey Peach Smash
instructions: Muddle all ingredients except whiskey in a bar glass. Add whiskey, and shake with ice. Strain into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass, garnish with a sprig of mint and a peach slice, and serve.

name: Whiskey Smash
instructions: Muddle the lemon, mint, water and simply syrup in the bottom of a mixing glass. Add bourbon, shake, and strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a sprig of mint, and serve.

name: Whiskey Sour
instructions: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the half-slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

name: Whiskey Sour Old Fashioned
instructions: Mix whiskey, bitters, and cherry juice in a ice-filled cocktail glass, and fill the remainder of the glass with sour mix. Garnish with olives or mushrooms and use a stir stick to mix.

name: Whiskey to Go
instructions: Pour whiskey, gin, lemon juice and sugar into a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake, strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, and serve.

name: Whisky Mac
instructions: Pour both of the ingredients into a wine goblet with no ice.

name: Whisky Martini
instructions: Mix ingredients in a cocktail glass with chipped ice.

name: White Cargo
instructions: Mix in a blender until smooth. Add a little extra white wine if necessary. Serve in a chilled wine goblet.

name: White Christmas
instructions: Shake, strain into a cocktail glass, and sprinkle with grated chocolate.

name: White Dove
instructions: Pour amaretto and cream de cacao into a blender cup with the ice cream. Blend until smooth like a shake. Line the inside of a snifter glass with chocolate syrup. Pour drink into a cup and top with whipped cream. Add cherry to top.

name: White Heart
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: White Irish
description:
A White Russian variant with slightly smoother, less contrasted colors and flavors. Baileys Irish Cream itself is half whiskey and half cream, leading to a very agreeable blend.Fill chilled old-fashioned with ice. Pour Irish Cream directly over ice, allowing it to settle fully. Pour Irish Whikey (Jameson's or Bushmills) slowly down the inside of the glass, allowing it to settle fully. Top with very cold and vigorously shaken Light Cream, pouring it slowly down the inside of the glass. Serve, unagitated, with cocktail straw.

With a little patience, this drink's ingredients will float naturally and slowly seep into one another (shaking the cream thickens and aerates it, and surprisingly, Baileys is heavier than whiskey). The ambitious may omit ice and use a spoon to create defined layers.
instructions:
Fill chilled old-fashioned with ice. Pour Irish Cream directly over ice, allowing it to settle fully. Pour Irish Whikey (Jameson's or Bushmills) slowly down the inside of the glass, allowing it to settle fully. Top with very cold and vigorously shaken Light Cream, pouring it slowly down the inside of the glass. Serve, unagitated, with cocktail straw.

With a little patience, this drink's ingredients will float naturally and slowly seep into one another (shaking the cream thickens and aerates it, and surprisingly, Baileys is heavier than whiskey). The ambitious may omit ice and use a spoon to create defined layers.

name: White Lady
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: White Lady 1910
instructions: Shake vigourously with plenty of ice.

name: White Lily Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: White Lion Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: White Man
instructions: Pour Gentleman Jack whiskey into a whiskey sour glass. Add 3 ice cubes, top with Vanilla Coke, and serve.

name: White Mess
instructions: In a mixing tin, combine all ingredients with ice and shake. Strain into a double shot glass. Can also be made tall (add a little soda water to cut down on the cream)

name: White Mexican
instructions: Pour vodka and Baileys over ice in cocktail glass. The more ice the better. Top off with Horchata (Mexican rice soft drink) and garnish with 2 stir straws. Do not stir. Cocktail has a double layer effect. Allow consumer to stir if he/she would like to.

name: White Out
instructions: Build over crushed ice in an old-fashioned glass.

name: White Russian
instructions: Pour vodka and coffee liqueur over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Fill with light cream and serve.

name: White Russian #2
instructions: Serve over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass.

name: White Russian #3
instructions: Pour vanilla vodka and kahlua over ice. Top off with light cream and enjoy.

name: White Sands
instructions: Shake and strain into a frosted cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a cherry, and serve.

name: White Spider
instructions: Pour over lots of ice.

name: White Spider #2
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into cocktail glass.

name: White Trash
instructions: Pour ingredients over ice. Garnish with a lime wedge. Ingredients can be varied to taste.

name: White Ukrainian
description: "Many things Russian are actually a slightly watered down version of something cooler in Ukrainian (anyone who tells you differently is buying into years of communist propoganda).  So clearly a White Russian is just a watered down version of the real drink which has been kept hidden behind the iron curtain for far too long.". Thanks to Anna Lawrence.Pour all alcohol directly into glass (over ice, if preferred).  Add milk.  Stir.  Serve.
instructions: Pour all alcohol directly into glass (over ice, if preferred).  Add milk.  Stir.  Serve.

name: White Way Cocktail
instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Whitecap Margarita
instructions: Place all ingredients into a blender and blend until smooth. Serve in a margarita glass.

name: Whiting Sunset
instructions: Pour vodka, tequila and orange juice into a cocktail glass. Finally, add a dash of grenadine.

name: Whitney
instructions: Add ingredients chilled for better flavor. Avoid ice cubes to prevent watered down taste. Mix rum first (must be a white rum), add a dark type of wine (blush or red is fine), and finally a touch of lemon juice. Get ready to have fun!

name: Why Not?
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Wicked Tasty Treat
instructions: Dip the rim of a cocktail glass in amaretto and then into powdered sugar. Shake all alcohol and cream with ice and strain into the rimmed cocktail glass. Garnish with a cinnamon stick and whipped cream (optional)

name: Wicked Willy
instructions: Pour into a frosted wine glass, and serve.

name: Widow Maker
instructions: Fill an old-fashioned glass half full with ice. Add first three ingredients into the glass and sway lightly to mix them together. Add the 2 drops of grenadine for the red hour glass on the bottom of the widow maker spider.

name: Widow Woods' Nightcap
instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Widow's Kiss
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Wiggle Worm
instructions: Pour vodka in first. Put cherry in last. Add ice if needed. Mix well and serve in a cocktail glass.

name: Wild Bill's Lemonade
instructions: Pour ingredients into a large ice-filled rocks glass. Stir well, garnish with two slices of lemon, and serve.

name: Wild Buttery Squirrel
instructions: Pour into a stainless steel shaker over ice. Shake until ice cold, pour into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass, and serve.

name: Wild Irish Buttery Squirrel
instructions: Pour ingredients into a stainless steel shaker over ice. Shake until ice cold, and pour into a chilled ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Serve.

name: Wild Irish Rose
instructions: Serve in an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice.

name: Wild Island
instructions: Shake and strain into a champagne saucer filled with crushed ice. Garnish with an orange wedge and serve.

name: Wild Jackalope
instructions: Pour the whisky, peppermint schnapps and Pernod into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, and strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Wild Slippery Mudslide
instructions: Pour hershey's chocolate syrup around the inside rim of a rocks glass. Fill with ice, add all ingredients, and serve.

name: Wild Squirrel Sex
instructions: Fill a 16 oz. cup with ice. Add shots and almost-fill with equal parts of sour mix and cranberry juice. Top with a splash of grenadine, and serve.

name: Wild Thing
instructions: Pour over ice into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.

name: Wild White Slippery Mudslide
instructions: Pour hershey's chocolate syrup around the inside lip of a rocks glass. Fill with ice, add ingredients, and serve.

name: Wilfred's Weather
instructions: Pour the vermouth, gin, Ricard and bitters into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Will Rogers
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Wimbledon Cup
instructions: Shake, strain into a champagne saucer, and serve.

name: Windex
description: The Windex looks and smells like Windex and tastes like fizzy Kool-Aid.Combine and mix vodka, blue UV, and lemon lime-soda in a highball glass.
instructions: Combine and mix vodka, blue UV, and lemon lime-soda in a highball glass.

name: Windjammer
instructions: Stir first three ingredients together and pour over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Top with a maraschino cherry.

name: Winds of War Martini
description: No other vodka or gin must be used other than Grey Goose and Bombay Sapphire--the name "Winds of War" comes from the fact that Grey Goose is made in France and Bombay Sapphire is made in England--two countries with a long history of war with each other.Pour Grey Goose and Bombay Sapphire into a shaker.  Shake and strain into a martini glass.  Garnish with a dash of black pepper and serve.
instructions: Pour Grey Goose and Bombay Sapphire into a shaker.  Shake and strain into a martini glass.  Garnish with a dash of black pepper and serve.

name: Wine Cooler
instructions: Mix wine and lemon-lime soda. Pour over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass.

name: Winky
instructions: Pour wink soda over gin in a glass, add ice if desired, and serve.

name: Winston Martini
instructions: Add a dash of frangelico to a mixing glass, swill to coat, and discard the excess. Add the rum, gin and lime juice, stir, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel, and serve.

name: Winter Garden
instructions: Shake, strain into a glass filled with crushed ice, and serve.

name: Winter Parker
instructions: Pour ingredients into a shaker with ice cubes, shake and strain into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a lime wedge, and serve.

name: Wisconsin Badger
description: Scott Bentley, inventor - instructor at the Bartending College, 739 S.108th St. West Allis, WI. The Wisconsin Badger incorporates flavors of the state - cranberrys, apples and berries - and favorites of the state - brandy, schnaaps and beer. The Wisconsin Badger, a new refreshing legend...Fill mug w/ice and add ingredients. Stir with a red and white straw (preferably). Serve with a New Glarus Spotted Cow beer chaser.
instructions: Fill mug w/ice and add ingredients. Stir with a red and white straw (preferably). Serve with a New Glarus Spotted Cow beer chaser.

name: Wiseguy
description: Invented by H.B. Stone. It is suggested not to add the dash of bitters unless Bombay Sapphire or another vapor-infused gin is used, or the drink may be too harsh. The glass has a pleasant aroma even when emptied.Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a slice of lemon rind above the drink and rub along the rim, but do not drop into the drink.
instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a slice of lemon rind above the drink and rub along the rim, but do not drop into the drink.

name: Witch Hunt
instructions: Pour into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice, and serve.

name: Witch of Venice
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Witch's Brew
instructions: Shake all the ingrediants together and serve in a chilled glass.

name: Witch's Tit
instructions: Pour the Kahlua into a pousse cafe glass. Carefully float the cream on top by pouring over the back of a teaspoon. Place a maraschino cherry in the center, and serve.

name: Wobbly Knee
instructions: Blend briefly with a glassful of crushed ice, and strain into a double-cocktail glass. Sprinkle with grated chocolate, and serve.

name: Wolf's Lair
instructions: Shake, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.

name: Wonder Bra
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve.

name: Wong Tong Cocktail
instructions: Pour liquids into a strainer with 4 - 6 ice cubes, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with cherries, and serve.

name: Woodpecker
instructions: Pour vodka over 4 ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Add peychaud bitters, and stir.

name: Woodward Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: World Peace Cocktail
description:
A creation of master mixologist Jonathan Pogash for the World Bar opposite the United Nations in New York. Sells for $15.00 with 15% being donated directly to the UN's peace keeping efforts. A blue cocktail with the chocolate white dove of peace!

"We are using cocktail diplomacy to help bring about peace to an increasingly restless world." Mark Grossich, CEO of Hospitality Holdings.Place all the liquid ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with the white chocolate dove (or bird of choice).

To make the dove use a bird shaped cookie cutter on a bar of white chocolate.
instructions:
Place all the liquid ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with the white chocolate dove (or bird of choice).

To make the dove use a bird shaped cookie cutter on a bar of white chocolate.

name: Worried Monk
instructions: Shake, strain into an old-fashioned glass three-quarters filled with broken ice, and serve.

name: Wysoosler
instructions: Pour the vermouth, gin, green chartreuse and orange bitters into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Xanthia Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Xaviera
instructions: Shake briefly with a glassful of crushed ice in a double-cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of orange and a cherry, add short straws, and serve.

name: Xeres Cocktail
instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: XYZ Cocktail
instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Yale Cocktail
instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Yang Martini
instructions: Pour into a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with olives, and serve.

name: Yellow Boxer
instructions: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve.

name: Yellow Parrot
instructions: Stir with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Yellow Rattler
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cocktail onion) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cocktail onion and serve.

name: Yellow Strawberry
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except banana slice) with ice and strain into a chilled whiskey sour glass. Garnish with the banana slice and serve.

name: Yeoman's Passion
instructions: Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with slices of lime and lemon, and serve.

name: Yin Martini
instructions: Stir to chill in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with oriental fruit or litchi nut.

name: YIP!
instructions: Fill glass with Tequila, then club soda, then squeze a slice of lemon, toss in and add one ice cube, stir, drink, enjoy.

name: Yolanda
instructions: Shake all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

name: Yum-Yum
instructions: Shake and strain into a double-cocktail glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a slice of lime, and serve.

name: Za Za
instructions: Pour a dash of angostura bitters into the bottom of the glass. Add gin and dubonnet. Stir.

name: Zen Saketini
instructions: Mix 1 part Zen and 2 parts sake with ice in a shaker. Strain and pour into a cocktail glass.

name: Zero Gravity
instructions: Adjust to taste. Stir em all together and enjoy!

name: Ziemes Martini Apfelsaft
instructions: Serve without ice. The juice should be at room temperature.

name: Zinger
instructions:
Get a shot glass and pour in three shots of the Schnapps. Do the same with the Surge Cola. Then down it like Scheetz would.

*Add 1 shot Strawberry Schnapps for an alternate taste.

name: Zip Drive
description:
Served at a bar called Nectar, in the Bellagio Resort Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas, now defunct. Shake all ingredients over ice and strain into a Martini glass. No garnish.

Cheers!

Note:  Sugar syrup is a solution of sugar and water that is cooked over low heat until clear, then boiled for a minute or so.  I can be made in various densities:

Thin: 3 parts water to 1 part sugar.
Medium: 2 parts water to 1 part sugar.
Heavy: Equal parts water and sugar.
instructions:
Shake all ingredients over ice and strain into a Martini glass. No garnish.

Cheers!

Note:  Sugar syrup is a solution of sugar and water that is cooked over low heat until clear, then boiled for a minute or so.  I can be made in various densities:

Thin: 3 parts water to 1 part sugar.
Medium: 2 parts water to 1 part sugar.
Heavy: Equal parts water and sugar.

name: Zippy's Revenge
instructions: Mix Kool-Aid to taste then add Rum and Amaretto. Shake well to dissolve the sugar into the Kool-Aid. Serve cold.

name: Zombie #6
instructions: Mixed in a shaker on ice. Serve in a tumbler on crushed ice.

name: Zorbatini
instructions: Serve in a cocktail glass, and garnish with a green olive.

name: Zorro's Revenge
description: Similar to the shot drink "abortion". Zorro's Revenge has no grenadine, which is more of a visual effect in the shot. The drink is more suitable to sipping than drinking as a shot.Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Zultry Zoe
instructions: Pour tequila, galliano and Mexican hot chocolate (cooled to room temperature) into an Irish coffee cup or glass almost filled with crushed ice. Stir well, and serve.
